Title: Finance (No. 2) Act 2023
Date: 2024-06-25
Publisher: Statute Law Database
Identifier: http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2023/30

## Finance (No. 2) Act 2023

                                    Most Gracious Sovereign
W e  , Your Majesty’s most dutiful and loyal subjects, the Commons of the
United Kingdom in Parliament assembled, towards raising the necessary supplies
to defray Your Majesty’s public expenses, and making an addition to the public
revenue, have freely and voluntarily resolved to give and to grant unto Your
Majesty the several duties hereinafter mentioned; and do therefore most humbly
beseech Your Majesty that it may be enacted, and be it enacted by the King’s
most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords
Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and
by the authority of the same, as follows:—

### Income tax, corporation tax and capital gains tax

#### Income tax charge, rates etc

##### Income tax charge for tax year 2023-24

1

Income tax is charged for the tax year 2023-24.

##### Main rates of income tax for tax year 2023-24

2

For the tax year 2023-24 the main rates of income tax are as follows—

2.a

the basic rate is 20%,

2.b

the higher rate is 40%, and

2.c

the additional rate is 45%.

##### Default and savings rates of income tax for tax year 2023-24

3

3.1

For the tax year 2023-24 the default rates of income tax are as follows—

3.1.a

the default basic rate is 20%,

3.1.b

the default higher rate is 40%, and

3.1.c

the default additional rate is 45%.

3.2

For the tax year 2023-24 the savings rates of income tax are as follows—

3.2.a

the savings basic rate is 20%,

3.2.b

the savings higher rate is 40%, and

3.2.c

the savings additional rate is 45%.

##### Freezing starting rate limit for savings for tax year 2023-24

4

4.1

For the tax year 2023-24 the amount specified in section 12(3) of ITA 2007
(the starting rate limit for savings) is “£5,000”.

4.2

Accordingly, section 21 of that Act (indexation) does not apply in relation to
the starting rate limit for savings for that tax year.

#### Corporation tax charge and rates

##### Charge and main rate for financial year 2024

5

5.1

Corporation tax is charged for the financial year 2024.

5.2

The main rate of corporation tax for that year is 25%.

##### Standard small profits rate and fraction for financial year 2024

6

6.1

For the purposes of Part 3A of CTA 2010, for the financial year 2024—

6.1.a

the standard small profits rate is 19%, and

6.1.b

the standard marginal relief fraction is 3/200ths.

#### Capital allowances

##### Temporary full expensing etc for expenditure on plant or machinery

7

7.1

Part 2 of CAA 2001 (plant and machinery allowances)   is amended as follows .

7.2

Section 39 (first-year allowances available for certain types of qualifying
expenditure only) has effect as if after the entry relating to section 45O
there were inserted—

section 45S expenditure on plant or machinery in other cases

.

7.3

Chapter 4 has effect as if after section 45R there were inserted—

########### Expenditure on plant or machinery in other cases

7.3.45S

Expenditure is first-year qualifying expenditure if—

7.3.45S.a

it is incurred on or after 1 April 2023  ...,

7.3.45S.b

it is incurred by a company within the charge to corporation tax,

7.3.45S.c

it is expenditure on plant or machinery which is unused and not second-hand,
and

7.3.45S.d

it is not excluded by section 45T (exclusion of expenditure under
disqualifying arrangements) or 46 (general exclusions).

########### Exclusion of expenditure incurred under disqualifying arrangements

7.3.45T

7.3.45T.1

Expenditure is not first-year qualifying expenditure under section 45S if the
expenditure is incurred directly or indirectly in consequence of, or otherwise
in connection with, disqualifying arrangements.

7.3.45T.2

Arrangements are “ disqualifying arrangements ” for the purposes of this
section if—

7.3.45T.2.a

the main purpose, or one of the main purposes, of the arrangements is to
secure a tax advantage connected with expenditure being first-year qualifying
expenditure under section 45S (including securing the advantage by avoiding a
balancing charge under section 59A or 59B or reducing the amount or timing of
such a charge), and

7.3.45T.2.b

it is reasonable, taking account of all the relevant circumstances—

7.3.45T.2.b.i

to conclude that the arrangements are, or include steps that are, contrived,
abnormal or lacking a genuine commercial purpose, or

7.3.45T.2.b.ii

to regard the arrangements as circumventing the intended limits of relief
under this Act or otherwise exploiting shortcomings in this Act.

7.3.45T.3

In this section “arrangements” include any agreement, understanding, scheme,
transaction or series of transactions (whether or not legally enforceable).

7.4

Section 46 (general exclusions) has effect as if—

7.4.a

in subsection (1), after the entry relating to section 45O there were
inserted—

section 45S expenditure on plant or machinery in other cases

, and

7.4.b

after subsection (4) there were inserted—

7.4.b.4A

General exclusion 6 does not prevent expenditure being first-year qualifying
expenditure under  section 45S  if the plant or machinery is provided for
leasing under an excluded lease of background plant or machinery for a
building.

7.5

Section 52 (first-year allowances) has effect as if in subsection (3), in the
table, at the end there were inserted—

Expenditure qualifying under  section 45S  (expenditure on plant or machinery
in other cases) which is not special rate expenditure 100% Expenditure
qualifying under  section 45S  (expenditure on plant or machinery in other
cases) which is special rate expenditure 50%

.

7.6

Chapter 5 has effect as if after section 59 there were inserted—

########### Special balancing charge in cases of 

############ Disposal of assets where first-year allowance made under section 45S for expenditure which is not special rate expenditure

7.6.59A

7.6.59A.1

This section applies if a first-year allowance has been made to a company in
respect of first-year qualifying expenditure under  section 45S  which is not
special rate expenditure.

7.6.59A.2

If the company is required to bring a disposal value into account for an
accounting period by reference to the plant or machinery on which the
expenditure is incurred, the company is liable to a balancing charge for that
period (whether or not it is also liable to any other balancing charge for
that period).

7.6.59A.3

The amount of the balancing charge is the relevant proportion of the disposal
value; and the relevant proportion is determined by dividing—

7.6.59A.3.a

the amount of the expenditure that was the subject of the allowance, by

7.6.59A.3.b

the total amount of expenditure that has been the subject of that or any other
first-year allowance or has been allocated to a pool for that or any other
accounting period.

7.6.59A.4

In relation to the accounting period for which the disposal value is brought
into account, TDR (see section 55(1)(b)) for the pool to which the expenditure
that was the subject of the allowance was allocated is to be reduced by the
amount of the balancing charge.

############ Disposal of assets where first-year allowance made under section 45S for expenditure which is special rate expenditure

7.6.59B

7.6.59B.1

This section applies if a first-year allowance has been made to a company in
respect of first-year qualifying expenditure under  section 45S  which is
special rate expenditure.

7.6.59B.2

If the company is required to bring a disposal value into account for an
accounting period by reference to the plant or machinery on which the
expenditure is incurred, the company is liable to a balancing charge for that
period (whether or not it is also liable to any other balancing charge for
that period).

7.6.59B.3

The amount of the balancing charge is the relevant proportion of the disposal
value; and the relevant proportion is determined by—

7.6.59B.3.a

dividing the amount of the expenditure that was the subject of the allowance
by two, and

7.6.59B.3.b

dividing the result of that division by the total amount of expenditure that
has been the subject of that or any other first-year allowance or has been
allocated to a pool for that or any other accounting period.

7.6.59B.4

In relation to the accounting period for which the disposal value is brought
into account, TDR (see section 55(1)(b)) for the pool to which the expenditure
that was the subject of the allowance was allocated is to be reduced by the
amount of the balancing charge.

############ Sections 

7.6.59C

7.6.59C.1

This section applies if arrangements are entered into the main purpose, or one
of the main purposes, of which is—

7.6.59C.1.a

to secure that a balancing charge under section  59A  or  59B  is not
chargeable on a company, or

7.6.59C.1.b

to secure a reduction in the amount, or a change in the timing, of a balancing
charge under section  59A  or  59B   which is chargeable on a company.

7.6.59C.2

Sections  59A  and  59B  are to have effect as if the arrangements had not
been entered into.

7.6.59C.3

In this section “arrangements” include any agreement, understanding, scheme,
transaction or series of transactions (whether or not legally enforceable).

##### Annual investment allowance to remain at £1M beyond temporary period

8

8.1

The amount of £1,000,000 which is specified in section 51A(5) of CAA 2001 as
the maximum allowance in relation to expenditure incurred in the period
beginning with 1 January 2019 and ending with 31 March 2023 is to be the
amount of the maximum allowance in relation to expenditure incurred on or
after 1 April 2023 (as well as in relation to expenditure incurred in that
period).

8.2

Accordingly—

8.2.a

in section 51A of CAA 2001, for the amount specified in subsection (5) as the
maximum allowance (which in the absence of this section would be £200,000 in
relation to expenditure incurred on or after 1 April 2023) substitute
“£1,000,000” , and

8.2.b

the temporary AIA transitional provisions cease to have effect in relation to
chargeable periods beginning before 1 April 2023 and ending on or after that
date.

8.3

For this purpose “ the temporary AIA transitional provisions ” means—

8.3.a

paragraphs 2 and 3 of Schedule 13 to FA 2019, and

8.3.b

section 32 of FA 2019, section 15 of FA 2021 and section 12 of FA 2022 so far
as relating to those paragraphs.

##### First-year allowance for expenditure on electric vehicle charge points

9

In section 45EA of CAA 2001 (expenditure on plant or machinery for electric
vehicle charging point), in subsection (3) (the relevant period), in
paragraphs (a) and (b), for “2023” substitute  “2025” .

#### Other reliefs relating to businesses

##### Relief for research and development

10

Schedule 1  makes provision in relation to the corporation tax relief
contained in Chapter 6A of Part 3 of CTA 2009 (trade profits: R&D expenditure
credits) and Part 13 of CTA 2009 (additional relief for expenditure on
research and development)—

10.a

conferring relief in respect of expenditure on data and cloud computing
services,

10.b

about the administration and management of claims for relief,

10.c

about the circumstances in which an enterprise counts as a small or medium-
sized enterprise and in which accounts are to be treated as prepared on a
going concern basis, and

10.d

limiting relief for expenditure incurred on payments to expenditure incurred
on payments made before the making of a claim for the relief.

##### Treatment of profits from patents etc: small profits rate of corporation tax

11

11.1

In section 357A of CTA 2010 (election for special treatment of profits from
patents etc), in subsection (3)—

11.1.a

in the formula, in both places it occurs, for “MR” substitute  “AR” ;

11.1.b

for the definition of “MR” substitute—

                                                               “ AR ” means,
in relation to a company—
in a case where corporation tax is charged at the standard small profits rate
on the company’s taxable total profits of the accounting period mentioned in
subsection (1) which are not ring fence profits, that rate, or
in any other case, the main rate of corporation tax.

11.2

The amendments made by  subsection (1)  have effect in relation to accounting
periods beginning on or after 1 April 2023.

##### Energy (oil and gas) profits levy: de-carbonisation allowance

12

12.1

The Energy (Oil and Gas) Profits Levy Act 2022 is amended as follows.

12.2

In section 2 (additional expenditure treated as incurred for purposes of
section 1), for subsection (3) substitute—

12.2.3

For the purposes of section 1 the company is to be treated as if, in addition
to the investment expenditure (“the IE”) incurred by it in the accounting
period, it had incurred in that period—

12.2.3.a

expenditure of an amount equal to 80% of the amount of the IE, in a case where
the expenditure is capital expenditure on the de-carbonisation of its upstream
petroleum production, and

12.2.3.b

expenditure of an amount equal to 29% of the amount of the IE, in any other
case.

12.3

In that section, after subsection (4) insert—

12.3.4A

For the purposes of this section, where a company incurs expenditure part of
which is capital expenditure on the de-carbonisation of its upstream petroleum
production and part of which is not, the expenditure is to be apportioned on a
just and reasonable basis.

12.4

After that section insert—

########### Section 2: meaning of expenditure on “de-carbonisation of upstream petroleum production”

12.4.2A

12.4.2A.1

Expenditure incurred by a company is expenditure on the “ de-carbonisation of
its upstream petroleum production ” for the purposes of section 2 if—

12.4.2A.1.a

the expenditure is incurred in qualifying circumstances, and

12.4.2A.1.b

the main purpose, or one of the main purposes, in incurring the expenditure is
to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the carrying on by the company of its
ring fence trade.

12.4.2A.2

For this purpose expenditure is incurred in qualifying circumstances if—

12.4.2A.2.a

it is incurred on the provision of an alternative energy asset which is to be
used for the purpose of generating or storing power for use by the company in
its upstream petroleum facilities,

12.4.2A.2.b

it is incurred on the modification of an asset so that it becomes an
alternative energy asset which is to be used for that purpose,

12.4.2A.2.c

it is incurred on the provision of an asset (such as a cable or substation)
where the asset is to be used to make a connection to the electric grid or to
an alternative energy asset so that (in either case) the company can use the
power generated in its upstream petroleum facilities,

12.4.2A.2.d

it is incurred for the purpose of reducing or eliminating flaring or venting,

12.4.2A.2.e

it is incurred for the purpose of capturing greenhouse gas emissions, or

12.4.2A.2.f

it is incurred for the purpose of monitoring or measuring greenhouse gas
emissions (including with a view to detecting leaks of greenhouse gas
emissions from the company’s upstream petroleum facilities).

12.4.2A.3

For the purposes of this section an asset is an alternative energy asset if
the asset generates or stores power (wholly or mainly) from sources of energy
other than fossil fuels.

12.4.2A.4

For the purposes of this section references to a company’s upstream petroleum
facilities are to any facility used by the company for the purposes of its oil
extraction activities.

12.4.2A.5

In this section—

            “ the electric grid ” means—
in Great Britain, anything which is a transmission system, or a distribution
system connected to a transmission system, for the purposes of Part 1 of the
Electricity Act 1989, or
in Northern Ireland, anything which is a transmission system, or a
distribution system connected to a transmission system, for the purposes of
Part 2 of the Electricity (Northern Ireland) Order 1992,
“ emissions ” has the same meaning as it has in the Climate Change Act 2008
(see section 97),
“ fossil fuel ” has the meaning given by section 32M of the Electricity Act
1989, and
“ greenhouse gas ” has the same meaning as it has in the Climate Change Act
2008 (see section 92).

12.5

In section 3 (section 2: meaning of “operating expenditure”), for subsection
(5) substitute—

12.5.5

In this section “ tariff receipts ” has the meaning given by section 291A of
CTA 2010.

12.6

In section 18(1) (interpretation)—

12.6.a

after the definition of “energy (oil and gas) profits levy” insert—

                                                               “ facility ”
means a platform, an oil well, a platform well, an oil well head or upstream
petroleum infrastructure,

, and

12.6.b

omit the “and” before the definition of “ring fence trade” and after that
definition insert—

                                                               “ upstream
petroleum infrastructure ” means any upstream petroleum pipeline, oil
processing facility or gas processing facility (as those expressions are
defined by section 90 of the Energy Act 2011 but as if that section also
applied (with the appropriate modifications) to Northern Ireland).

12.7

The amendments made by subsections (2) to (4) have effect in relation to
expenditure incurred on or after 1 January 2023 and the amendments made by
subsections (5) and (6) have effect in relation to expenditure incurred on or
after 26 May 2022.

15.4.b

15.4.c

15.4.d

#### Reliefs for employees

##### CSOP schemes: share value limit and share class

16

16.1

Schedule 4 to ITEPA 2003 (CSOP schemes) is amended as follows.

16.2

In paragraph 6 (limit on value of shares subject to options)—

16.2.a

in sub-paragraph (1), in the words after paragraph (b), for “£30,000”
substitute  “£60,000” ;

16.2.b

after sub-paragraph (4) insert—

16.2.b.5

The Treasury may by regulations amend sub-paragraph (1) by substituting a
different sum of money for the sum for the time being specified there.

16.3

In paragraph 15 (requirements relating to shares that may be subject to share
options: introduction), in sub-paragraph (1)—

16.3.a

after the entry for paragraph 17 insert  “, and” ;

16.3.b

omit the entry for paragraph 20 and the “, and” before it.

16.4

Omit paragraph 20 (requirements as to other shareholdings).

16.5

In paragraph 27 (requirement about share options granted in exchange), in sub-
paragraph (4)(a), for “20” substitute  “18” .

16.6

The amendments made by  subsection (2)  have effect for the purposes of
determining whether a share option may be granted to an individual on or after
6 April 2023 (“ the commencement day ”).

16.7

The amendments made by subsections  (3)  and  (4)  have effect in relation to—

16.7.a

share options granted on or after the commencement day, and

16.7.b

shares acquired by the exercise of share options on or after the commencement
day (regardless of when those share options were granted).

16.8

The amendment made by subsection  (5)  has effect in relation to share options
granted on or after the commencement day.

16.9

A CSOP scheme which was approved by, or notified to, His Majesty’s Revenue and
Customs before the commencement day has effect on and after the commencement
day with any modifications needed to reflect the amendments made by this
section.

16.10

In particular, such a CSOP scheme has effect from the commencement day with—

16.10.a

the substitution of  “£60,000”  for “£30,000” in any provision required by
paragraph 6 of Schedule 4 to ITEPA 2003;

16.10.b

the omission of any provision that (before the amendments made by this
section) was required by paragraph 20 of that Schedule by virtue of paragraph
15(1) of that Schedule.

16.11

In this section, “ CSOP scheme ” and “ share option ” have the same meaning as
in the CSOP code (see paragraph 37 of Schedule 4 to ITEPA 2003).

##### Enterprise management incentives: restricted shares and declarations

17

17.1

Schedule 5 to ITEPA 2003 (enterprise management incentives) is amended as
follows.

17.2

In Part 5 (requirements relating to options), in paragraph 37 (terms of option
to be agreed in writing) omit sub-paragraphs (4) and (5).

17.3

In Part 7 (notification of option to HMRC), in paragraph 44 (notice of option
to be given to HMRC)—

17.3.a

in sub-paragraph (5)—

17.3.a.i

after paragraph (a) insert  “and” ;

17.3.a.ii

omit paragraph (c) and the “, and” immediately before it;

17.3.b

omit sub-paragraphs (5A) and (6).

17.4

In Part 8 (supplementary provisions) omit paragraph 57A (penalty for non-
compliance with paragraph 44(5A)).

17.5

The amendments made by this section have effect in relation to—

17.5.a

share options granted on or after 6 April 2023, or

17.5.b

share options granted before 6 April 2023 which are capable of being exercised
on or after that date (“relevant options”).

17.6

But if—

17.6.a

an employer company has granted relevant options to persons by reason of their
employment with the company, and

17.6.b

the effect of  subsection (5) (b)  would otherwise be that a relevant
requirement would not be met in relation to one or more share options granted
before 6 April 2023,

the employer company must, on or before the relevant day, make arrangements
for determining which of the relevant options, or the extent to which those
options, are to take the benefit of  subsection (5) (b)  without a relevant
requirement not being met in relation to any share options granted before 6
April 2023.

17.7

The arrangements must—

17.7.a

set out the criteria by reference to which the determination will be made, and

17.7.b

be made available to persons who may be affected by the determination.

17.8

If the employer company fails to make arrangements in accordance with
subsection (7)  in a case where it is required to do so by  subsection (6) ,
which relevant options, or the extent to which those options, take the benefit
of  subsection (5) (b)  is to be determined in the chronological order in
which those options were granted (and where two or more relevant options were
granted at the same time, the extent to which those options take the benefit
of  subsection (5) (b)  is, where necessary, to be apportioned between those
options).

17.9

In this section—

                                    “ relevant day ” means 6 July following
the end of the first tax year in which a relevant option granted by the
employer company is exercised;
“ relevant options ” has the meaning given in  subsection (5) (b) ;
“ relevant requirement ” means any of the requirements in paragraphs 5(1),
6(2) or (4) or 7(1) of Schedule 5 to ITEPA 2003;
“ share option ” and “ employer company ” have the same meaning as in the EMI
code (see paragraph 59 of Schedule 5 to ITEPA 2003).

##### Modification of certain existing transitional protections

23

23.1

In Part 4 of FA 2004 (pension schemes etc), Schedule 36 (transitional

23.2

In paragraph 12 (enhanced protection), in sub-paragraph (2), after “ceases to
apply if” insert  “the notice under sub-paragraph (1) is given on or after 15
March 2023 and” .

23.3

In paragraph 27 (enhanced protection: modifications of paragraph 2 of Schedule
29), in sub-paragraph (3), in the substituted sub-paragraph (5) of paragraph
2, for the words after  “the permitted maximum is”  substitute

the lower of—

23.3.a

the applicable amount calculated in accordance with paragraph 3, and

23.3.b

the amount that would have been the applicable amount calculated in accordance
with paragraph 3 if the lump sum had been paid on 5 April 2023.

In the Taxation of Pension Schemes (Transitional Provisions) Order 2006 ( S.I.

##### Relief relating to net pay arrangements

25

In FA 2004, in Part 4 (pension schemes etc), in Chapter 4 (certain tax reliefs
and exemptions), after section 193 (relief under net pay arrangements) insert—

######### Net pay arrangements: relief where no income tax liability

25.193A

25.193A.1

This section applies where—

25.193A.1.a

an individual is entitled to be given relief in accordance with section 193 in
respect of the payment of a contribution under a pension scheme,

25.193A.1.b

the individual is entitled to a personal allowance, in accordance with section
35(1) of ITA 2007 (personal allowance), for the tax year in which the payment
is made (“the relevant tax year”), and

25.193A.1.c

the amount of the individual’s total income for the relevant tax year does not
exceed the personal allowance specified in section 35(1) of ITA 2007 for the
relevant tax year.

25.193A.2

The Commissioners for His Majesty’s Revenue and Customs must make arrangements
to secure that, so far as reasonably practicable and subject to provision made
under subsection  (5) , they pay to the individual the appropriate amount in
relation to the contribution.

25.193A.3

The appropriate amount is—

25.193A.3.a

where the individual’s total income for the relevant tax year plus the
contribution does not exceed the personal allowance specified in section 35(1)
of ITA 2007 for the relevant tax year, an amount equal to income tax at the
relevant rate on the whole of the contribution, and

25.193A.3.b

where the individual’s total income for the relevant tax year plus the
contribution does exceed the personal allowance specified in section 35(1) of
ITA 2007 for the relevant tax year, an amount equal to income tax at the
relevant rate on an amount calculated in accordance with this formula—

  C - E       where—
C equals the whole of the contribution, and
E equals the amount by which the personal allowance is exceeded by the
individual’s total income for the relevant tax year plus the contribution.

25.193A.4

The arrangements must secure that an amount which the Commissioners are
required to pay in relation to a contribution is paid as soon as reasonably
practicable after the tax year in which the contribution is paid.

25.193A.5

The arrangements must include a procedure for the purposes of allowing an
individual to whom an amount would otherwise have to be paid under subsection
(2)  to decline to receive that amount.

25.193A.6

For the purposes of income tax, apart from determining whether this section
applies or calculating the appropriate amount in accordance with  subsection
(3) , an amount paid to an individual in accordance with the arrangements is
to be treated as if it were earnings within Chapter 1 of Part 3 of ITEPA 2003—

25.193A.6.a

from an employment in the relevant tax year, and

25.193A.6.b

in respect of duties performed in the United Kingdom.

25.193A.7

In  subsection (3) , “the relevant rate” is—

25.193A.7.a

where the individual is a Scottish taxpayer for the relevant tax year, the
Scottish basic rate for that year,

25.193A.7.b

where the individual is a Welsh taxpayer for the relevant tax year, the Welsh
basic rate for that year, and

25.193A.7.c

in all other cases, the basic rate for that tax year.

25.193A.8

In this section, “ total income ” has the meaning given by section 23 of ITA
2007 (the calculation of income tax liability).

25.193A.9

The Treasury may by regulations amend or otherwise modify this section.

25.193A.10

Regulations under  subsection (9)  may make different provision for different
purposes.

##### Qualifying care relief: increase in individual’s limit

28

28.1

28.2.a

28.3.a

28.3.b

28.3.d

28.4

After section 828 insert—

########### Indexation of the fixed amount and the amount per adult and child

28.4.828A

28.4.828A.1

This section provides for increases in the amounts specified in—

28.4.828A.1.a

section 808(2) (the fixed amount), and

28.4.828A.1.b

section 811(1A) and (2)(a) and (b) (the amount per adult or child),

if the consumer prices index for the September before the start of a tax year
is higher than it was for the previous September.

28.4.828A.2

The amount specified in section 808(2) for the tax year is found as follows—

      Step 1 : multiply the amount for the previous tax year by the same
percentage as the percentage increase in the consumer prices index.
Step 2 : if the result of Step 1 is a multiple of £10, it is the increase for
the tax year.                                                   If the result
of Step 1 is not a multiple of £10, round it up to the nearest amount which is
a multiple of £10 and that amount is the increase for the tax year.
Step 3 : add the increase for the tax year to the amount for the previous tax
year and the result is the amount for the tax year.

28.4.828A.3

The amounts specified in section 811(1A) and (2)(a) and (b) for the tax year
are found as follows—

      Step 1 : multiply the amount for the previous tax year by the same
percentage as the percentage increase in the consumer prices index.
Step 2 : if the result of Step 1 is a multiple of £5, it is the increase for
the tax year.                                                   If the result
of Step 1 is not a multiple of £5, round it up to the nearest amount which is
a multiple of £5 and that amount is the increase for the tax year.
Step 3 : add the increase for the tax year to the amount for the previous tax
year and the result is the amount for the tax year.

28.4.828A.4

Before the start of the tax year the Treasury must make an order replacing the
amounts specified in the provisions listed in subsection (1) with the amounts
which, as a result of this section, are the amounts for the tax year.

28.4.828A.5

In this section “ consumer prices index ” means the all items consumer prices
index published by the Statistics Board.

28.5

In section 873(3) (orders made by Treasury etc not subject to negative
resolution procedure), after paragraph (c) (but before the “or” at the end)
insert—

28.5.ca

section 828A (qualifying care relief: indexation of amounts),

.

28.6

The amendments made by this section have effect for the tax year 2023-24 and
subsequent tax years.

#### Provisions relating to insurance

##### Transfer of basic life assurance and general annuity business

30

30.1

In Part 2 of FA 2012 (insurance companies carrying on long-term business),
after section 130 insert—

########### Re-insurance in the course of transfer of BLAGAB

30.1.130A

30.1.130A.1

This section applies to a re-insurer in relation to the re-insurance of the
whole, or part of, a cedant’s basic life assurance and general annuity
business, if—

30.1.130A.1.a

the business is not excluded business for the purposes of section 57(2)(e),
and

30.1.130A.1.b

it is reasonable to suppose that the arrangements for the re-insurance are
made, or are operated, in connection with an insurance business transfer
scheme under which the business will be transferred to the re-insurer or a
person connected with the re-insurer.

30.1.130A.2

Where the arrangements are operated, but were not made, in connection with the
insurance business transfer scheme, this section is to apply to the re-insurer
from the later of—

30.1.130A.2.a

the beginning of the accounting period in which it is reasonable to suppose
that the arrangements were first operated in connection with the transfer, and

30.1.130A.2.b

15 December 2022.

30.1.130A.3

Where this section applies in relation to re-insurance, that re-insurance (so
far as it is of basic life assurance and general annuity business) is to be
treated as excluded business for the purposes of section 57(2)(e) (and that
business is referred to in this section as “ the re-insured business ”).

30.1.130A.4

Accordingly—

30.1.130A.4.a

the re-insured business is, or forms part of, the separate basic life
assurance and general annuity business of the re-insurer (see section 66(2)),
and

30.1.130A.4.b

accounting profit or loss and the tax adjustments (within the meaning of
section 114(4)) referable to the re-insured business are, for the purposes of
provision made by or under this Part or Schedule 5 to FA 2022, to be allocated
to the basic life assurance and general annuity business.

30.1.130A.5

But, subject to  subsection (6) , no amount referable to the re-insured
business is to be included in the determination of the I-E profit of the re-
insurer for an accounting period (and accordingly, subject to that subsection,
the I-E profit referable to that business for the accounting period will be
nil).

30.1.130A.6

Any BLAGAB trade loss relieved for an accounting period (see section 78(5))
that is referable to the re-insured business is to be included (as a deduction
in Step 4 in section 76) in determining the adjusted BLAGAB management
expenses of the re-insurer for the accounting period (which, accordingly, may
result in the I-E profit referable to that business for the accounting period
being greater than nil).

30.1.130A.7

Nothing in this section is to be taken to affect the liability of the cedant
to corporation tax.

30.1.130A.8

For the purposes of this section “ arrangements ” includes any agreement,
scheme, transaction or understanding (whether or not legally enforceable).

30.1.130A.9

Section 1122 of CTA 2010 (connected persons) has effect for the purposes of
this section.

30.2

The amendment made by  this section  is treated as having come into force on
15 December 2022 and applies to the re-insurance of basic life assurance and
general annuity business whenever the arrangements for that re-insurance were
made.

30.3

Where, on or after 15 December 2022, a re-insurer adopts IFRS 17 in relation
to one or more accounting periods that commence before that date, the
amendment made by  this section  has effect, in relation to that re-insurer,
for those accounting periods.

30.4

In  subsection (3)  “ IFRS 17 ” means International Financial Reporting
Standard 17 (insurance contracts) issued by the International Accounting
Standards Board.

#### International matters

##### Share exchanges involving non-UK incorporated close companies

36

36.1

TCGA 1992 is amended in accordance with  subsections (2)  and  (3) .

36.2

After section 138 (exchange of securities and schemes of reconstruction:
procedure for clearance in advance) insert—

########### Share exchanges involving non-UK incorporated close companies

36.2.138ZA

36.2.138ZA.1

Section  138ZB  applies where—

36.2.138ZA.1.a

section 135 or 136 applies to an issue by a company (“ company B ”) of shares
in or debentures of that company (“the exchanged shares or debentures”) in
exchange for or in respect of shares in or debentures of another company (“
company A ”),

36.2.138ZA.1.b

immediately before the issue is made, company A is a close company which is
incorporated in the United Kingdom (whether or not it is resident in the
United Kingdom),

36.2.138ZA.1.c

immediately after the issue is made, company B is a close company which is not
incorporated in the United Kingdom (whether or not it is resident in the
United Kingdom), and

36.2.138ZA.1.d

the person to whom the exchanged shares or debentures are issued (“ P ”) is an
individual who meets the conditions in  subsection (2) .

36.2.138ZA.2

Those conditions are that—

36.2.138ZA.2.a

immediately before the issue is made, P—

36.2.138ZA.2.a.i

has a material interest in company A, and

36.2.138ZA.2.a.ii

is a participator in company A, and

36.2.138ZA.2.b

immediately after the issue is made, P—

36.2.138ZA.2.b.i

has a material interest in company B, and

36.2.138ZA.2.b.ii

is a participator in company B.

36.2.138ZA.3

A person has a material interest in a company for the purposes of this section
if condition A or B is met.

36.2.138ZA.4

Condition A is that the person, an associate of the person, or the person or
an associate of the person together with one or more associates is—

36.2.138ZA.4.a

the beneficial owner of, or

36.2.138ZA.4.b

directly or indirectly able to control,

more than 5% of the ordinary share capital of the company.

36.2.138ZA.5

Condition B is that the person, an associate of the person, or the person or
an associate of the person together with one or more associates possesses or
is entitled to acquire such rights as would—

36.2.138ZA.5.a

in the event of the winding up of the company, or

36.2.138ZA.5.b

in any other circumstances,

give an entitlement to receive more than 5% of the assets which would then be
available for distribution among the participators.

36.2.138ZA.6

Chapter 2 of Part 10 of CTA 2010 (meaning of “close company” and related
terms) applies for the purposes of this section but with the omission of
section 442(a) (exclusion of non-UK resident companies).

36.2.138ZA.7

In relation to a company that has no share capital, this section applies as
if—

36.2.138ZA.7.a

references to shares in, or debentures of, the company included any interests
of the company possessed by members of the company, and

36.2.138ZA.7.b

the reference in  subsection (4)  to the ordinary share capital of the company
were to all such interests.

36.2.138ZA.8

In this section “ ordinary share capital ” has the meaning it has in the
Corporation Tax Acts (see section 1119 of CTA 2010).

########### Treatment of securities connected with such exchanges

36.2.138ZB

36.2.138ZB.1

Where this section applies (see  section 138ZA ), a security falling within
subsection (2)  is to be treated for the purposes of this Act as situated in
the United Kingdom (whether or not it would otherwise be so treated) if—

36.2.138ZB.1.a

it is held by P, other than as a result of a disposal of the security by P’s
spouse or civil partner (“ S ”) to P to which section 58 (no loss or gain on
disposals between spouses or civil partners) did not apply, or

36.2.138ZB.1.b

is held by S, other than as a result of a disposal of the security by P to S
to which that section did not apply.

36.2.138ZB.2

Those securities are as follows—

36.2.138ZB.2.a

the exchanged shares or debentures;

36.2.138ZB.2.b

a security of company B acquired by P on or after the day on which the
exchanged shares or debentures are issued;

36.2.138ZB.2.c

where—

36.2.138ZB.2.c.i

there is a repo (within the meaning of section 263A) in respect of a security,
and

36.2.138ZB.2.c.ii

that security falls within any of the paragraphs of this subsection (including
this paragraph),

any similar security (see section 263AA(5) and (6)) that P, or a person
connected with P, buys back under the repo;

36.2.138ZB.2.d

where—

36.2.138ZB.2.d.i

P transfers a security to another person under a stock lending arrangement
(within the meaning of section 263B), and

36.2.138ZB.2.d.ii

that security falls within any of the paragraphs of this subsection (including
this paragraph),

any security of a similar description (see section 263B(6)) transferred back
to P under the arrangement;

36.2.138ZB.2.e

a security of a company issued to P where—

36.2.138ZB.2.e.i

the security is issued in exchange for, or in respect of, another security,

36.2.138ZB.2.e.ii

section 135 or 136 applies to that issue,

36.2.138ZB.2.e.iii

the other security falls within any of the paragraphs of this subsection
(including this paragraph), and

36.2.138ZB.2.e.iv

P has a material interest in the company (within the meaning of  section 138ZA
(3) );

36.2.138ZB.2.f

where a security of a company, other than company B, falls within paragraph
(e) , a security of that company acquired by P on or after the first day on
which a security of that company fell within that paragraph.

36.2.138ZB.3

For the purposes of paragraphs  (b) ,  (f)  and  (e)  of  subsection (2) , it
does not matter whether or not—

36.2.138ZB.3.a

consideration was given for the security acquired by P, or

36.2.138ZB.3.b

the security acquired by P is of a different class from the exchanged shares
or debentures.

36.2.138ZB.4

If S acquires a security falling within  subsection (2)  as a result of a
disposal by P to which section 58 applies, subsections  (2)  and  (3)  have
effect, from the time of its acquisition by S (whether or not S continues to
hold it), as if every reference to “P” were to “P or S”.

36.2.138ZB.5

In this section—

            “ company B ”, “ P ”, and “ the exchanged shares or debentures ”
are to be construed in accordance with section  138ZA ;
“ security ” means—
shares in, or debentures of, a company, or
interests of a company that has no share capital that are possessed by members
of the company.

########### Election to disapply section 135 or 136

36.2.138ZC

36.2.138ZC.1

This section applies where section 138ZB would, but for an election under this
section, apply in relation to the issue by a company of shares in or
debentures of that company in exchange for, or in respect of, shares in or
debentures of another company.

36.2.138ZC.2

The person to whom the shares or debentures are issued may elect for section
135 or 136 not to apply to the issue, and accordingly—

36.2.138ZC.2.a

the exchange or scheme of reconstruction in question will not be treated as a
reorganisation within the meaning of section 126, and

36.2.138ZC.2.b

section  138ZB  will not apply in relation to the issue.

36.2.138ZC.3

An election under this section must be made on or before the first anniversary
of the 31 January following the tax year in which the shares or debentures are
issued.

36.3

In section 288 (interpretation), in the definition of “close company”, at the
end insert  “(subject to  section 138ZA (6) )” .

36.4

The amendments made by  subsections (2)  and  (3)  have effect in relation to
an issue of shares or debentures made on or after 17 November 2022.

36.5

In section 830 of ITTOIA 2005 (meaning of “ relevant foreign income ”), after
subsection (3) insert—

36.5.3A

“ Relevant foreign income ” does not include income paid in respect of a
security, within the meaning of section  138ZB  of TCGA 1992, if—

36.5.3A.a

the security is treated, for the purposes of that Act, as situated in the
United Kingdom as a result of section  138ZB  of that Act, and

36.5.3A.b

that section applies in respect of the security as a result of an issue of
shares in or debentures of a company in exchange for, or in respect of, shares
in or debentures of another company that is incorporated, and is resident, in
the United Kingdom.

36.6

The amendment made by  subsection (5)  is treated as having come into force on
17 November 2022.

##### Double taxation relief: foreign nominal rates

38

38.1

No extended time limit claim may be made on or after 20 July 2022 for a credit
calculated by reference to a foreign nominal rate of tax unless  subsection
(2)  or  (3)  applies in relation to the claim.

38.2

This subsection  applies in relation to an extended time limit claim if the
adjustment in the amount of tax payable that gives rise to the claim—

38.2.a

is not calculated by reference to a foreign nominal rate of tax, and

38.2.b

occurred on or after 21 July 2016 but before 20 July 2022.

38.3

This subsection  applies in relation to an extended time limit claim if the
claim relates to an accounting period that ended before 20 July 2022 (“ the
relevant accounting period ”) and as at that date—

38.3.a

an appeal under section 31 of TMA 1970 against an assessment to tax in
relation to the relevant accounting period has been brought but has not been
finally determined or withdrawn,

38.3.b

an enquiry under paragraph 5 of Schedule 1A to TMA 1970 into a claim in
relation to the relevant accounting period could be opened or is in progress,

38.3.c

an appeal against a conclusion stated in respect of such a claim, or an
amendment of such a claim, as a result of an enquiry under that paragraph—

38.3.c.i

could be brought, or

38.3.c.ii

has been brought but has not been finally determined or withdrawn,

38.3.d

an enquiry under Part 4 of Schedule 18 to FA 1998 into the company tax return
for the relevant accounting period could be opened or is in progress, or

38.3.e

an appeal against an amendment of that return as a result of an enquiry under
that Part—

38.3.e.i

could be brought, or

38.3.e.ii

has been brought but has not been finally determined or withdrawn.

38.4

An “extended time limit claim” is a claim under—

38.4.a

section 79 of TIOPA 2010 (extended time limits for certain claims), or

38.4.b

section 806(2) of ICTA (extended time limits for certain claims in relation to
accounting periods to which section 79 of TIOPA 2010 does not apply).

#### Chargeable gains

##### Payments to farmers under the lump sum exit scheme etc

39

39.1

An amount paid to a person (“ P ”) under the lump sum exit scheme is—

39.1.a

in a case where P satisfied the eligibility conditions when the payment was
made, to be treated as an amount of capital nature that is treated as a
chargeable gain accruing to P on the disposal of an asset for the purposes of
TCGA 1992;

39.1.b

in a case where P did not satisfy the eligibility conditions when the payment
was made, to be treated as an amount of a revenue nature.

39.2

Where—

39.2.a

a person (“ P ”) makes an application for a lump sum under the lump sum exit
scheme,

39.2.b

P satisfies the eligibility conditions at any time during the interim period,
and

39.2.c

during the interim period, an amount is paid to P under the basic payment
scheme,

the amount is to be treated as an amount of capital nature that is treated as
a chargeable gain accruing to P on the disposal of an asset for the purposes
of TCGA 1992.

39.3

Where—

39.3.a

a person (“ P ”) makes an application for a lump sum under the lump sum exit
scheme,

39.3.b

P does not satisfy the eligibility conditions at any time during the interim
period, and

39.3.c

during the interim period, an amount is paid to P under the basic payment
scheme,

the amount is to be treated as an amount of a revenue nature.

39.4

For the purposes of this section—

                                    the “ lump sum exit scheme ” means the
Agriculture (Lump Sum Payment) (England) Regulations 2022 ( S.I. 2022/390 );
the “ basic payment scheme ” means  Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013  of the
European Parliament and of the Council of 17 December 2013 establishing rules
for direct payments to farmers under support schemes within the framework of
the common agricultural policy and repealing  Council Regulation (EC) No
637/2008  and  Council Regulation (EC) No 73/2009 ;
“ eligibility conditions ” means the conditions in regulation 5 of the lump
sum exit scheme;
the “ interim period ”, in relation to P, means the period—
beginning with the day on which the lump sum exit scheme came into force (see
regulation 1(1) of that scheme), and
ending with the scheme end date;
the “ scheme end date ” has the same meaning as in the lump sum exit scheme
(see regulation 2(1) of that scheme).

39.5

This section has effect in relation to amounts whether paid before or after
the coming into force of this Act.

##### Contracts completed after ordinary notification period

40

40.1

In TCGA 1992, after section 28 (time of disposal and acquisition where asset
disposed of under contract) insert—

########### Contracts completed after ordinary notification period

40.1.28A

40.1.28A.1

This section applies in relation to chargeable gains or allowable losses
accruing on the disposal and acquisition of an asset under a contract where
the asset is conveyed or transferred after the ordinary notification period
relating to the chargeable period in which the asset was disposed of and
acquired in accordance with section 28.

40.1.28A.2

The following references are to be read as references to the chargeable period
in which the conveyance or transfer takes place—

40.1.28A.2.a

the references in section 7(1C) of the Management Act (income tax and capital
gains tax: period for giving notice of chargeability) to the year of
assessment;

40.1.28A.2.b

the references in sections 34(1) and 36(1) and (1A) of the Management Act
(income tax and capital gains tax: time limits for assessments) to the year of
assessment to which an assessment relates;

40.1.28A.2.c

the reference in section 43(1) of the Management Act (income tax and capital
gains tax: time limit for making claims) to the year of assessment to which a
claim relates;

40.1.28A.2.d

the reference in paragraph 2(2) of Schedule 18 to the Finance Act 1998
(corporation tax: period for giving notice of chargeability) to the accounting
period;

40.1.28A.2.e

the references in paragraph 46(1), (2) and (2A) of Schedule 18 to the Finance
Act 1998 (corporation tax: time limits for assessments) to the accounting
period to which an assessment relates;

40.1.28A.2.f

the reference in paragraph 55 of Schedule 18 to the Finance Act 1998 (general
time limit for making claims) to the accounting period to which a claim for
relief relates.

40.1.28A.3

For the purposes of  subsection (1) , the “ ordinary notification period ”
relating to a chargeable period is—

40.1.28A.3.a

in the case of capital gains tax, the period of 6 months from the end of the
chargeable period, and

40.1.28A.3.b

in the case of corporation tax, the period of 12 months from the end of the
chargeable period.

40.1.28A.4

Where a claim, election, application or notice is made, given, revoked or
varied by virtue of this section, all such adjustments shall be made, whether
by way of discharge or repayment of tax or the making of amendments,
assessments or otherwise, as are required to take account of the effect of the
taking of that action on any person’s liability to tax for any chargeable
period.

40.2

The amendment made by  subsection (1)  has effect—

40.2.a

for the purposes of corporation tax, in relation to any disposal and
acquisition of an asset under a contract that is entered into on or after 1
April 2023, and

40.2.b

for all other purposes, in relation to any disposal and acquisition of an
asset under a contract that is entered into on or after 6 April 2023.

##### Separated spouses and civil partners

41

41.1

TCGA 1992 is amended in accordance with  subsections (2)  to  (5) .

41.2

In Part 3 (individuals, partnerships, trusts and collective investment
schemes), in Chapter 1 (miscellaneous provisions), in section 58 (spouses and
civil partnerships), for subsection (1) substitute—

41.2.1A

If an individual (“ A ”) disposes of an asset to another individual (“ B ”) in
circumstances where any of subsections (1B) to (1D) applies, A and B are to be
treated as if B acquired the asset from A for a consideration of such amount
as would secure that on the disposal neither a gain nor a loss would accrue to
A.

41.2.1B

This subsection applies where the disposal is made while A and B—

41.2.1B.a

are married to, or are civil partners of, each other, and

41.2.1B.b

are living together.

41.2.1C

This subsection applies where the disposal is made—

41.2.1C.a

while A and B are married to, or are civil partners of, each other,

41.2.1C.b

at a time when A and B have ceased to live together, and

41.2.1C.c

on or before the earlier of—

41.2.1C.c.i

the last day of the third tax year after the tax year in which A and B ceased
to live together, or

41.2.1C.c.ii

the day on which a court grants an order or decree for A and B’s divorce, the
annulment of their marriage, the dissolution or annulment of their civil
partnership, their judicial separation or, as the case may be, their
separation in accordance with a separation order.

41.2.1D

This subsection applies where—

41.2.1D.a

A and B have ceased to be, or are in the process of ceasing to be, married to,
or civil partners of, each other, and

41.2.1D.b

the disposal of the asset is in accordance with an agreement or order within
subsection (2)(a) or (b) of section 225B (disposals in connection with divorce
etc), but as if, in subsection (2)(a), after “partner” there were inserted  “,
or former spouse or civil partner,” .

41.3

In section 225B (disposals in connection with divorce etc)—

41.3.a

in subsection (1)(b), after “to” insert  “someone other than” ;

41.3.b

in subsection (3), after “disposal to” insert  “someone other than” .

41.4

After section 225B insert—

########### Deferred payments on disposals in connection with divorce etc

41.4.225BA

41.4.225BA.1

This section applies where—

41.4.225BA.1.a

an individual (“ A ”) ceases to live with A’s spouse or civil partner (“ B ”)
in a dwelling-house or part of a dwelling-house,

41.4.225BA.1.b

immediately before A ceases to live with B, the dwelling-house or part is A’s
only or main residence,

41.4.225BA.1.c

A disposes of, or of an interest in, that dwelling-house or part to B (“the
initial disposal”), and

41.4.225BA.1.d

the initial disposal is in accordance with a deferred sale agreement or order.

41.4.225BA.2

If—

41.4.225BA.2.a

in accordance with the deferred sale agreement or order A receives a sum in
respect of a share of any profit made by B upon B’s disposal of, or of an
interest in, the dwelling-house or part, and

41.4.225BA.2.b

the receipt of that sum would be treated (apart from this section) as a
disposal falling with section 22 (disposal where capital sums derived from
assets),

that receipt is to be treated for the purposes of this Act as a gain
attributable to the initial disposal but accruing to A at the time the sum is
received.

41.4.225BA.3

In this section, a “deferred sale agreement or order” is an agreement or order
of a court which—

41.4.225BA.3.a

is within paragraph (a) or (b), as the case may be, of section 225B(2)
(agreements and orders of the court in relation to divorce etc), and

41.4.225BA.3.b

includes a term entitling A to receive a share of any profit made by B as
mentioned in subsection (2)(a).

41.5

In Part 8 (supplemental), in section 288 (interpretation), in subsection (3),
after “partner” insert  “(however expressed)” .

41.6

The amendments made by  this section  apply in relation to disposals made on
or after 6 April 2023.

##### Carried interest: election to pay tax as scheme profits arise

42

42.1

TCGA 1992 is amended as follows.

42.2

After section 103KF insert—

########### Election for carried interest gains to be chargeable as scheme profits arise

42.2.103KFA

42.2.103KFA.1

An individual (“ A ”) may make an election under this section in respect of an
investment scheme (“ the relevant scheme ”) if—

42.2.103KFA.1.a

section 103KA applies in relation to A and the relevant scheme, or

42.2.103KFA.1.b

it is reasonable to expect that it will apply in relation to A and the
relevant scheme.

42.2.103KFA.2

Subsection  (3)  applies for a tax year (“the relevant tax year”) where an
election made under this section has effect for that tax year.

42.2.103KFA.3

A chargeable gain is deemed to arise to A in the relevant tax year and is to
be treated as accruing to A immediately before the end of the relevant tax
year.

42.2.103KFA.4

The amount of the gain is the amount given by reducing—

42.2.103KFA.4.a

the amount of carried interest that would arise to A in the relevant tax year
in the circumstances mentioned in subsection  (5) , by

42.2.103KFA.4.b

the sum of chargeable gains deemed to arise to A under this section in respect
of the relevant scheme in previous tax years.

42.2.103KFA.5

Those circumstances are that—

42.2.103KFA.5.a

all of the investments held by the relevant scheme in the relevant tax year,
and previously held by the scheme, whose disposal would be relevant to A’s
entitlement to carried interest, were disposed of in the relevant tax year,

42.2.103KFA.5.b

the amount realised on the disposal of each investment that was not actually
disposed of in, or before, the relevant tax year were the amount of the costs
to the relevant scheme in acquiring that investment,

42.2.103KFA.5.c

all income that was received by the scheme (whether before or during the
relevant tax year) and that would be relevant to A’s entitlement to carried
interest, were received in the relevant tax year, and

42.2.103KFA.5.d

all profits realised by the scheme as a result of those disposals and the
receipt of that income were distributed to its investors in the relevant tax
year.

42.2.103KFA.6

Where—

42.2.103KFA.6.a

distributions were made by the scheme to external investors before the
relevant tax year, and

42.2.103KFA.6.b

the timing of those distributions affects the amount of carried interest that
actually arises to A,

the amount of carried interest to be presumed to arise in the circumstances
mentioned in  subsection (5)  is to reflect the fact those distributions were
made before the relevant tax year.

42.2.103KFA.7

But if reflecting that fact would lead to a presumption that an amount of
carried interest had arisen before the relevant tax year, any such amount is
to be presumed to arise in the relevant tax year.

42.2.103KFA.8

A chargeable gain treated as accruing to an individual under subsection  (3)
is a chargeable gain accruing on the disposal of an asset situated outside the
United Kingdom only to the extent that the individual performs investment
management services in respect of the relevant scheme outside the United
Kingdom.

42.2.103KFA.9

An election under this section—

42.2.103KFA.9.a

must be made by notice given to an officer of Revenue and Customs, and

42.2.103KFA.9.b

may not be revoked.

42.2.103KFA.10

A notice making an election—

42.2.103KFA.10.a

must state the first tax year for which it is to have effect, and

42.2.103KFA.10.b

may not be given after 31 January following the end of that tax year.

########### Election in relation to scheme to apply to associated schemes

42.2.103KFB

42.2.103KFB.1

Where an election has been made under section  103KFA  in relation to an
investment scheme (“ S ”) that is associated with another investment scheme,
the election applies in respect of the other scheme (whether or not the
conditions for an election to be made in respect of the other scheme were met
at that time).

42.2.103KFB.2

“ Associated ”, in relation to two or more investments schemes, is to be
construed in accordance with section 809FZZ of ITA 2007.

########### Interaction with other charges

42.2.103KFC

42.2.103KFC.1

The accrual of a chargeable gain treated as accruing to an individual under
section  103KFA (3)  does not prevent the individual or any other person being
charged to tax (whether income tax, capital gains tax or any other tax, and
including as a result of section 103KA) in relation to carried interest that
arises to the individual under arrangements with the relevant scheme.

42.2.103KFC.2

But  subsection (3)  applies where an individual—

42.2.103KFC.2.a

has made an election under section  103KFA ,

42.2.103KFC.2.b

has accrued a chargeable gain treated as accruing under section  103KFA (3) ,

42.2.103KFC.2.c

has paid (and has not been repaid) an amount of capital gains tax that is
attributable to that chargeable gain, and

42.2.103KFC.2.d

is charged to tax (whether income tax, capital gains tax or another tax) in
relation to carried interest that—

42.2.103KFC.2.d.i

arises to the individual under arrangements with the relevant scheme, and

42.2.103KFC.2.d.ii

arises in or after the tax year in which a gain first accrued under that
section.

42.2.103KFC.3

The individual may make a claim for one or more consequential adjustments to
be made reducing the tax mentioned in subsection  (2) (d) .

42.2.103KFC.4

On a claim under subsection  (3)  an officer of Revenue and Customs must make
such of the consequential adjustments claimed (if any) as are just and
reasonable.

42.2.103KFC.5

The value of any consequential adjustments made must not exceed the lesser of—

42.2.103KFC.5.a

the amount of capital gains tax paid as mentioned in subsection  (2) (c) , and

42.2.103KFC.5.b

the tax charged as mentioned in subsection  (2) (d) .

42.2.103KFC.6

Consequential adjustments may be made—

42.2.103KFC.6.a

in respect of any period, and

42.2.103KFC.6.b

by way of an assessment, the modification of an assessment, the amendment of a
claim, or otherwise.

42.2.103KFC.7

No claim may be made under section 103KE (carried interest: avoidance of
double taxation) in respect of tax charged as a result of the accrual of a
chargeable gain treated as accruing to an individual under section  103KFA (3)
.

########### Deemed accrual of loss where carried interest never arises

42.2.103KFD

42.2.103KFD.1

Subsection  (3)  applies where—

42.2.103KFD.1.a

an individual has made an election under section  103KFA ,

42.2.103KFD.1.b

the individual has accrued a chargeable gain treated as accruing under section
103KFA (3) , and

42.2.103KFD.1.c

the conditions in subsection  (2)  are met.

42.2.103KFD.2

Those conditions are that—

42.2.103KFD.2.a

all, or substantially all, of the investments of the relevant scheme have been
disposed of,

42.2.103KFD.2.b

the amount of carried interest that has arisen to the individual in respect of
the relevant scheme since the beginning of the first tax year in which a gain
is treated as accruing under section  103KFA (3)  is less than the sum of
chargeable gains treated as accruing to the individual under that section, and

42.2.103KFD.2.c

no further amount of carried interest can reasonably be expected to arise to
the individual under arrangements with the relevant scheme.

42.2.103KFD.3

The individual is to be treated as accruing a loss immediately before the end
of the tax year in which the conditions in subsection  (2)  are first met.

42.2.103KFD.4

The amount of that loss is the amount given by subtracting—

42.2.103KFD.4.a

the amount of carried interest that arose to the individual in respect of the
relevant scheme since the beginning of the first tax year in which a gain is
treated as accruing under section  103KFA (3) , from

42.2.103KFD.4.b

the sum of the chargeable gains that have accrued under section  103KFA (3)
(including any gain that accrues in respect of the tax year in which the loss
accrues).

42.2.103KFD.5

Where a loss has accrued to an individual as a result of  subsection (3) —

42.2.103KFD.5.a

section 103KFA (3)  does not apply (in relation to the individual and the
relevant scheme) for any tax year after the tax year in which the loss
accrued, and

42.2.103KFD.5.b

if carried interest arises to the individual in respect of the relevant scheme
after the loss accrued, the individual may not make a claim under  section
103KFC (3)  in respect of tax charged in relation to it.

########### Anti-avoidance

42.2.103KFE

42.2.103KFE.1

This section applies where an election was made by an individual under section
103KFA  and the main purpose, or one of the main purposes, of making the
election is to cause a loss to be treated as accruing to the individual under
subsection  (3)  of section  103KFD .

42.2.103KFE.2

Any such loss that would (in the absence of this section) accrue to the
individual under that subsection is to be counteracted by the making of such
adjustments as are just and reasonable.

42.2.103KFE.3

Any adjustments required to be made under this section (whether or not by an
officer of Revenue and Customs) may be made by way of—

42.2.103KFE.3.a

an assessment,

42.2.103KFE.3.b

the modification of an assessment, or

42.2.103KFE.3.c

amendment or disallowance of a claim, or otherwise.

42.3

In section 1H (the main rates of CGT), in subsection (9)—

42.3.a

omit the “or” at the end of paragraph (a), and

42.3.b

after that paragraph insert—

42.3.b.aa

under section  103KFA (3)  (gains on deemed carried interest where election
made), or

.

42.4

The amendments made by this section have effect for the tax year 2022-23 and
subsequent tax years.

##### Relief on disposal of joint interests in land

43

43.1

In section 248A of TCGA 1992 (roll-over relief on disposal of joint interests
in land: conditions), at end insert—

43.1.8

Section 248B applies in relation to cases where, immediately before the
disposal, the land is held by a partnership comprising the landowner and the
co-owner or co-owners (whether the partnership is formed in Scotland or
elsewhere) as it applies in relation to other cases (and the partners are
