306.4

If—

306.4.a

electricity generator levy is chargeable on company, and

306.4.b

under the Instalment Payment Regulations one or more instalment payments in
respect of the total liability of the company for an accounting period
beginning before the day on which this Act is passed are treated as becoming
due and payable before the day on which this Act is passed 2023 (“pre-
commencement instalments”),

any amount of electricity generator levy chargeable for that period is to be
ignored for the purposes of determining the amount of any pre-commencement
instalment.

306.5

The first instalment in respect of that liability which is treated as becoming

increased by the following amount, namely the difference between—

306.5.a

the aggregate amount of the pre-commencement instalments determined in
accordance with  subsection (4) , and

306.5.b

the aggregate amount of those instalments determined ignoring that subsection.

306.6

306.6.a

references to those Regulations are to be read as including a reference to

question”, and in regulation 8(2) “that regulation”, are to be read
accordingly), and

306.6.b

in regulation 9(3), the reference to those Regulations is to be read as
including a reference to those subsections.

306.7

In this section “ the Instalment Payment Regulations ” means the Corporation
Tax (Instalment Payments) Regulations 1998 ( S.I. 1998/3175 ).

##### Anti-avoidance

308

308.1

This section  applies to arrangements if the main purpose, or one of the main
purposes of the arrangements, is to—

308.1.a

reduce or avoid a charge to the electricity generator levy, or

308.1.b

otherwise avoid the effect of any of the provisions of  this Part .

308.2

Any such reduction or avoidance that would (in the absence of  this section )
arise from such arrangements is to be counteracted by the making of such
adjustments as are just and reasonable.

308.3

Where the arrangements result in a change in the composition of a generating
undertaking that is a group (including where such a group ceases to exist),
those adjustments may include adjustments to secure that the same liability to
electricity generator levy arises, and can be recovered from members of the
group, as if the composition of the group had not changed.

308.4

Any adjustments required to be made under  this section  (whether or not by an
officer of Revenue and Customs) may be made by way of—

308.4.a

an assessment,

308.4.b

the modification of an assessment,

308.4.c

amendment or disallowance of a claim,

or otherwise.

308.5

In  this section  “arrangements” include any agreement, understanding, scheme
transaction or series of transactions (whether or not legally enforceable).

##### Information sharing

309

309.1

This section  applies to information that—

309.1.a

is held by the Secretary of State, the Gas and Electricity Markets Authority
or the Northern Ireland Authority for Energy Regulation (each “a relevant
person”), and

309.1.b

is relevant to the electricity generator levy.

309.2

Information to which  this section  applies may be disclosed by a relevant
person (or anyone acting on behalf of that person) to the Commissioners for
His Majesty’s Revenue and Customs for the purposes of their functions relating
to electricity generator levy or any other tax.

309.3

Subject to  subsection (5) , no duty of confidentiality or other restriction
on disclosure (however imposed) prevents the disclosure of information in
accordance with  subsection (2) .

309.4

This section  does not limit the circumstances in which information may be
disclosed under—

309.4.a

section 105(2) to (4) of the Utilities Act 2000,

309.4.b

Article 63(2) to (4) of the Energy (Northern Ireland) Order 2003 ( S.I.
2003/419 (N.I. 6) ), or

309.4.c

any other enactment or rule of law.

309.5

Nothing in  this section  authorises the making of a disclosure which—

309.5.a

contravenes the data protection legislation (save that the power conferred by
this section  is to be taken into account in determining whether a disclosure
contravenes that legislation), or

309.5.b

is prohibited by any of Parts 1 to 7 or Chapter 1 of Part 9 of the
Investigatory Powers Act 2016 (save that the power conferred by  this section
is to be taken into account when determining whether a disclosure is
prohibited by those provisions).

##### Interaction of electricity generator levy with corporation tax

310

310.1

In calculating profits or losses for the purposes of corporation tax—

310.1.a

no deduction is allowed in respect of the electricity generator levy, and

310.1.b

no account is to be taken of any amount which is paid by a person to another
person for the purposes of meeting or reimbursing the cost of the electricity
generator levy.

310.2

Subsection (3)  applies if—

310.2.a

two related generating undertakings (within the meaning of  section 298 ) have
an agreement between them in relation to the surrender of amounts of shortfall
amounts (within the meaning of that section),

310.2.b

such an amount is surrendered between them in accordance with  section 299 ,
and

310.2.c

as a result of the agreement the undertaking to whom the amount is surrendered
makes a payment to the other undertaking that does not exceed the amount
surrendered.

310.3

The payment—

310.3.a

is not to be taken into account in determining the profits or losses of either
company for corporation tax purposes, and

310.3.b

for corporation tax purposes is not to be regarded as a distribution.

##### Regulations under 

311

311.1

Regulations under  this Part  are to be made by statutory instrument.

311.2

Regulations under  this Part  may—

311.2.a

make provision having retrospective effect, provided any such provision does
not have the effect of increasing the amount of the electricity generator levy
any generating undertaking is liable to;

311.2.b

make different provision for different purposes;

311.2.c

make supplementary, incidental and consequential provision;

311.2.d

make transitional or transitory provision and savings.

311.3

A statutory instrument containing regulations under  this Part  is subject to
annulment in pursuance of a resolution of the House of Commons.

##### Meaning of “qualifying new generating plant”

311A

311A.1

Generating plant is “qualifying new generating plant” if it is new generating
plant commissioned as part of a qualifying project that meets the new
investment condition.

311A.2

The new investment condition is met in relation to a qualifying project if on
21 November 2023 it was reasonable to conclude, having regard to all of the
circumstances, that there is a significant likelihood of the project not
proceeding.

311A.3

The Treasury may by regulations provide for cases in which qualifying projects
are to be treated as meeting the new investment condition.

311A.4

“ Qualifying project ” means a project to commission—

311A.4.a

new generating plant for—

311A.4.a.i

a new generating station, or

311A.4.a.ii

an existing generating station which (as a result of the project) is to be
wholly or substantially comprised of new generating plant, or

311A.4.b

new generating plant that increases the generating capacity of an existing
generating station.

311A.5

Subsection (6) applies where new generating plant that increases the
generating capacity of an existing generating station replaces existing
generating plant.

311A.6

Only so much of the new generating plant as represents generating capacity in
excess of the capacity of the generating plant it replaces is to be regarded
as qualifying new generating plant.

##### Minor definitions relating to electricity market

312

In this Part—

“ the Balancing and Settlement Code ” means the code for the governance of
electricity balancing and settlement in Great Britain which is maintained in
accordance with the conditions of transmission licences granted under section
6(1)(b) of the Electricity Act 1989 as that code has effect from time to time;
“ distribution system ” and “transmission system” mean anything which would be
such a system for the purposes of— Part 1 of the Electricity Act 1989, or Part
2 of the Electricity (Northern Ireland) Order 1992 ( S.I. 1992/231 (N.I. 1) );
“ feed-in tariff export payments ” means export payments within the meaning of
Schedule A to Condition 33 of the standard conditions of electricity supply
licences; “ generation ” does not include the release of electricity from a
battery; “ licensed distribution system ” means a distribution system operated
by the holder of a licence under— section 6(1)(c) of the Electricity Act 1989,
or Article 10(1)(bb) of the Electricity (Northern Ireland) Order 1992; “
licensed transmission system ” means a transmission system operated by the
holder of a licence under— section 6(1)(b) of the Electricity Act 1989, or
Article 10(1)(b) of the Electricity (Northern Ireland) Order 1992; “ the SEM
Memorandum ” means the Memorandum of Understanding referred to in Article 2(3)
of the Electricity (Single Wholesale Market) (Northern Ireland) Order 2007 (
S.I. 2007/913 (N.I. 7) ). “ settlement code ” means— the Balancing and
Settlement Code, or the Trading and Settlement Code; “ the standard conditions
of electricity supply licences ” means the standard conditions incorporated in
licences under section 6(1)(d) of the Electricity Act 1989 by virtue of
section 8A of that Act; “ the Trading and Settlement Code ” means the Single
Electricity Market Trading and Settlement Code referred to in the SEM
Memorandum as that code has effect from time to time.

#### Value added tax

##### Deposit schemes

315

In Part 3 of VATA 1994 (application of Act in particular cases), after section
55A insert—

######### Deposit schemes: designation

315.55B

315.55B.1

In sections 55C and 55D “ a designated deposit scheme ” means a deposit scheme
which is designated, for the purposes of this section, by regulations made by
the Commissioners.

315.55B.2

A “ deposit scheme ” means a scheme which is established—

315.55B.2.a

by regulations under Schedule 8 to the Environment Act 2021, or

315.55B.2.b

by or under any other enactment that makes similar provision for a returnable
deposit to be paid in relation to goods.

315.55B.3

In subsection (2)(b), the reference to an “ enactment ” includes a reference
to an enactment comprised in, or in an instrument made under—

315.55B.3.a

an Act of the Scottish Parliament,

315.55B.3.b

a Measure or Act of Senedd Cymru, or

315.55B.3.c

Northern Ireland legislation.

315.55B.4

Section 97(5) (statutory instruments: procedure) does not apply to a statutory
instrument containing only regulations under subsection (1).

######### Deposit schemes: value of supply

315.55C

315.55C.1

This section applies if—

315.55C.1.a

a taxable person makes a taxable (but not a zero-rated) supply of goods, and

315.55C.1.b

a deposit amount is payable in relation to the goods supplied.

315.55C.2

For the purposes of this section and section 55D, a “ deposit amount ” in
relation to goods is an amount that, in accordance with the provisions of a
designated deposit scheme—

315.55C.2.a

is added to the price payable for the goods, and

315.55C.2.b

must be repaid by a person, if the conditions for repayment under the scheme
are met.

315.55C.3

The deposit amount is to be disregarded in determining the amount of the
consideration for the purposes of calculating the value of the supply under
this Act.

######### Deposit schemes: liability to account for VAT on deposit amounts

315.55D

315.55D.1

For the purposes of this section, a person makes a “relevant deposit scheme
supply” if—

315.55D.1.a

the person makes the first supply of goods in relation to which a deposit
amount is payable (whether or not another person makes a subsequent supply of
those goods in relation to which a deposit amount is payable), and

315.55D.1.b

that supply is a taxable (but not a zero-rated) supply.

315.55D.2

A person who makes relevant deposit scheme supplies is liable to account for
and pay the VAT in respect of the deposit amount that, on the applicable
assumption, would have been charged in relation to the proportion of the
supplies that is determined, in accordance with provision made by or under
regulations under subsection (4), as being attributable to goods in respect of
which no deposit amount is repaid.

315.55D.3

The applicable assumption is that, in the case of those goods, section 55C(3)
is ignored and the deposit amount and the price payable for the goods are
regarded instead as indistinguishable parts of the consideration for the
supply of the goods.

315.55D.4

The Commissioners may by regulations make provision about accounting for VAT
in relation to designated deposit schemes including, in particular, provision—

315.55D.4.a

for the making of financial adjustments in connection with the liability to
account for and pay VAT under subsection (2);

315.55D.4.b

specifying the methods for calculating those adjustments;

315.55D.4.c

specifying the methods for determining or estimating the proportion of
supplies in respect of which deposit amounts are not repaid;

315.55D.4.d

about the manner in which, and the period within which, adjustments are to be
made (including adjustments for the correction of errors);

315.55D.4.e

specifying the conditions subject to which adjustments are to be made;

315.55D.4.f

conferring power on the Commissioners to make provision for the purposes of
paragraphs (a) to (e) by means of a notice published in accordance with the
regulations.

315.55D.5

The power to make regulations under subsection (4) includes power to make (or
to enable the Commissioners to make)—

315.55D.5.a

different provision for different purposes;

315.55D.5.b

different provision for different areas;

315.55D.5.c

consequential, supplementary, incidental, transitional, transitory or saving
provision.

#### Tobacco products duty

##### Rates of tobacco products duty

320

##### End of exempt period for HGV road user levy

326

326.1

In section 88 of FA 2020 (HGV road user levy)—

326.1.a

in the heading, at the end insert  “: exempt period” ;

326.1.b

in subsection (1), at the beginning insert  “Subject to section 88A,” ;

326.1.c

in subsection (3), at the beginning insert  “For the purposes of this section
and  section 88A ,” .

326.2

After that section insert—

########### HGV road user levy: transitional provision for end of exempt period

326.2.88A

326.2.88A.1

This section applies where—

326.2.88A.1.a

a UK heavy goods vehicle (the “charged vehicle”) is charged to vehicle excise
duty in respect of more than one period (a “charged period”) beginning within
the last 12 months of the exempt period, and

326.2.88A.1.b

the combined length of the charged periods is more than 12 months.

326.2.88A.2

Section 5(2) of the 2013 Act applies in relation to the charged vehicle in
respect of each complete month in the period (the “transitional liability
period”)—

326.2.88A.2.a

beginning with the day after the last exempt day in relation to the charged
vehicle, and

326.2.88A.2.b

ending with the end of the charged period during which that last exempt day
occurs.

326.2.88A.3

The last exempt day, in relation to a charged vehicle, is the last day of the
period of 12 months beginning with the day on which the first charged period
beginning within the last 12 months of the exempt period began.

326.2.88A.4

Subsection (5)  applies where, in relation to the charged vehicle—

326.2.88A.4.a

a notification has been made under section 7(2)(c) of the 2013 Act (an “off-
road notification”) in respect of a period beginning within the last 12 months
of the exempt period, and

326.2.88A.4.b

vehicle excise duty is charged in respect of a period beginning—

326.2.88A.4.b.i

after the day on which the off-road notification is made, and

326.2.88A.4.b.ii

within the last 12 months of the exempt period.

326.2.88A.5

In calculating the period of 12 months mentioned in  subsection (3)  ignore
the number of whole months in the period beginning with the day on which the
off-road notification is made and ending with the first day of the period
described in  subsection (4) (b) .

326.2.88A.6

The Secretary of State, and any person who may exercise powers on behalf of
the Secretary of State under section 9 of the 2013 Act (collection of levy),
may (in addition to having the powers, duties and liabilities mentioned in
that section) give a notice (a “payment notice”) to a person liable for HGV
road user levy in respect of a transitional liability period.

326.2.88A.7

A payment notice must state—

326.2.88A.7.a

the amount of HGV road user levy for which the person is liable in respect of
the transitional liability period,

326.2.88A.7.b

how the amount is to be paid, and

326.2.88A.7.c

that payment must be made within the period of 28 days beginning with the day
on which the notice is given.

326.2.88A.8

The amount in  subsection (7) (a)  is given by—

L × M 12       where—         L is the yearly rate of HGV road user levy
applicable in relation to the vehicle on the first day of the transitional
liability period, and           M is the number of whole months during the
transitional liability period.

326.2.88A.9

In relation to the transitional liability period—

326.2.88A.9.a

a person commits an offence under section 11 of the 2013 Act (offence of using
or keeping heavy goods vehicle if levy not paid) only if the person—

326.2.88A.9.a.i

has been given a payment notice, and

326.2.88A.9.a.ii

has failed to make payment in accordance with that notice, and

326.2.88A.9.b

section 7(5A) of the Vehicle Excise and Registration Act 1994 has effect as if
the reference to HGV road user levy having been paid were a reference to it
having been paid in accordance with a payment notice.

326.2.88A.10

In this section “ UK heavy goods vehicle ” has the same meaning as in the HGV
Road User Levy Act 2013 (see section 2 of that Act).

#### Administration

##### Right to repayment of income tax to be inalienable

333

333.1

A right of an individual to a repayment of income tax from HMRC may not be
assigned.

333.2

Every assignment of a right of an individual to a repayment of income tax from
HMRC, and every agreement to assign any such right, is void.

333.3

Subsection  (2)  has effect in relation to assignments and agreements to
assign of which HMRC receives notice on or after 15 March 2023.

333.4

In the application of this section to Scotland the reference to assignment of
a right is to be read as a reference to assignation, “assign” being construed
accordingly.

333.5

In this section “ HMRC ” means His Majesty’s Revenue and Customs.

##### Late payment interest on value added tax

334

334.1

In the Finance Act 2009, Sections 101 and 102 (Value Added Tax) (Late Payment
Interest and Repayment Interest) (Exceptions and Consequential Amendments)
Order 2022 ( S.I. 2022/1298 ), in Part 2 (exceptions), before article 2
insert—

########### Exception from section 101 of the Finance Act 2009 - late payment interest

334.1.1A

334.1.1A.1

Section 101 of the Finance Act 2009 (late payment interest on sums due to
HMRC) does not apply to annual accounting scheme instalments.

334.1.1A.2

In paragraph (1) “ annual accounting scheme instalment ” means an amount
payable to HMRC by virtue of regulation 50(2)(a) of the VAT Regulations.

334.2

In Part 2 of Schedule 53 to FA 2009 (late payment interest start date), after
paragraph 11 insert—

########### VAT due after excess payment or credit from HMRC

334.2.11ZA

334.2.11ZA.1

This paragraph applies to any amount of value added tax which is due and
recoverable from a person by virtue of—

334.2.11ZA.1.a

section 73(9) of VATA 1994, in relation to an amount assessed and notified to
the person under subsection (2) of that section, or

334.2.11ZA.1.b

section 80C(1) of that Act.

334.2.11ZA.2

The late payment interest start date in respect of that amount is the date on
which HMRC paid or credited that amount to the person.

334.3

Where, ignoring this subsection, the late payment interest start date in
respect of an amount would, by virtue of paragraph 11ZA of Schedule 53 to FA
2009 (inserted by subsection  (2) ), be a date before 15 March 2023, the late
payment interest start date in respect of that amount is instead 15 March
2023.

334.4

The amendment made by subsection  (1)  is treated as having been made under
section 101(2)(c) of FA 2009 (power to specify descriptions of amounts payable
to HMRC that are not subject to late payment interest).

334.5

This section is treated as having come into force on 15 March 2023.

#### Charities and community amateur sports clubs

##### Definition of “charity” restricted to UK charities

344

344.1

In Part 1 of Schedule 6 to FA 2010 (definition of “charity” etc), in paragraph
2 (jurisdiction condition)—

344.1.a

in sub-paragraph (1) omit paragraph (b) (and the “or” before it);

344.1.b

omit sub-paragraphs (3) to (5).

344.2

In relation to a body of persons or trust that has asserted its status as a
charity, the amendments made by this section have effect—

344.2.a

for the purposes of income tax, for the tax year 2024-25 and subsequent tax
years;

344.2.b

for the purposes of capital gains tax, in relation to disposals made on or
after 6 April 2024;

344.2.c

for the purposes of corporation tax, in relation to accounting periods
beginning on or after 1 April 2024;

344.2.d

for the purposes of value added tax, in relation to supplies made, and
acquisitions and importations taking place, on or after 1 April 2024;

344.2.e

for the purposes of inheritance tax, in relation to transfers of value made on
or after 1 April 2024;

344.2.f

for the purposes of stamp duty, in relation to any instrument executed on or
after 1 April 2024;

344.2.g

for the purposes of stamp duty land tax, in relation to any land transaction
the effective date of which is on or after 1 April 2024;

344.2.h

for the purposes of stamp duty reserve tax, in relation to any agreement to
transfer securities in respect of which the relevant day (within the meaning
of section 87(2) of FA 1986) is or is after 1 April 2024;

344.2.i

for the purposes of annual tax on enveloped dwellings, for the chargeable
period beginning with 1 April 2024 and subsequent chargeable periods;

344.2.j

for the purposes of diverted profits tax, in relation to accounting periods
beginning on or after 1 April 2024.

344.3

Notwithstanding subsection  (2) (g) , the amendments made by this section do
not have effect for the purposes of stamp duty land tax in relation to a
transaction entered into by a body of persons or trust that has asserted its
status as a charity if—

344.3.a

the transaction is effected in pursuance of a contract entered into and
substantially performed before 1 April 2024, or

344.3.b

the transaction—

344.3.b.i

is effected in pursuance of a contract entered into before 15 March 2023, and

344.3.b.ii

is not excluded for the purposes of this paragraph by subsection  (6) .

344.4

In relation to a body of persons or trust that has not asserted its status as
a charity, the amendments made by this section have effect—

344.4.a

for the purposes of income tax—

344.4.a.i

for the tax year 2022-23 so far as it falls on or after 15 March 2023, and

344.4.a.ii

for subsequent tax years;

344.4.b

for the purposes of capital gains tax, in relation to disposals made on or
after 15 March 2023;

344.4.c

for the purposes of corporation tax, in relation to accounting periods
beginning on or after 15 March 2023;

344.4.d

for the purposes of value added tax, in relation to supplies made, and
acquisitions and importations taking place, on or after 15 March 2023;

344.4.e

for the purposes of inheritance tax, in relation to transfers of value made on
or after 15 March 2023;

344.4.f

for the purposes of stamp duty, in relation to any instrument executed on or
after 15 March 2023;

344.4.g

for the purposes of stamp duty land tax, in relation to any land transaction
the effective date of which is on or after 15 March 2023;

344.4.h

for the purposes of stamp duty reserve tax, in relation to any agreement to
transfer securities in respect of which the relevant day (within the meaning
of section 87(2) of FA 1986) is or is after 15 March 2023;

344.4.i

for the purposes of annual tax on enveloped dwellings—

344.4.i.i

for the chargeable period beginning with 1 April 2022 so far as it falls on or
after 15 March 2023, and

344.4.i.ii

for subsequent chargeable periods;

344.4.j

for the purposes of diverted profits tax, in relation to accounting periods
beginning on or after 15 March 2023.

344.5

Notwithstanding subsection  (4) (g) , the amendments made by this section do
not have effect for the purposes of stamp duty land tax in relation to a
transaction entered into by a body of persons or trust that has not asserted
its status as a charity if—

344.5.a

the transaction is effected in pursuance of a contract entered into and
substantially performed before 15 March 2023, or

344.5.b

the transaction—

344.5.b.i

is effected in pursuance of a contract entered into before that date, and

344.5.b.ii

is not excluded for the purposes of this paragraph by subsection  (6) .

344.6

A transaction is excluded for the purposes of subsection  (3) (b)  or  (5) (b)
if—

344.6.a

there is any variation of the contract, or assignment of rights under the
contract, on or after 15 March 2023,

344.6.b

the transaction is effected in consequence of the exercise on or after that
date of any option, right of pre-emption or similar right, or

344.6.c

on or after that date there is an assignment, subsale or other transaction
relating to the whole or part of the subject-matter of the contract as a
result of which a person other than the purchaser under the contract becomes
entitled to call for a conveyance.

344.7

If a company has an accounting period (“the straddling accounting period”)
that begins before a commencement date and ends on or after that date—

344.7.a

the part of the straddling accounting period that falls before that date, and

344.7.b

the part of the straddling accounting period that falls on or after that date,

are to be treated for relevant purposes as separate accounting periods.

344.8

In subsection  (7) —

                                    “ commencement date ” means the date
mentioned in subsection  (2) (c)  or  (4) (c) ;
“ relevant purposes ” means the purposes of determining the company’s
liability to any charge to a tax mentioned in subsection  (2)  or  (4) , or
eligibility for any relief relating to such a tax, that is affected by the
company’s status as a charity.

344.9

An apportionment to different periods which falls to be made as a result of
subsection  (4) (a) (i)  or  (i) (i)  is to be made on a time basis according
to the respective length of the periods.

For the corresponding rule applying to apportionments falling to be made as a
result of subsection  (7) , see section 1172 of CTA 2010.

344.10

For the purposes of this section a body of persons or trust has “asserted its
status as a charity” if—

344.10.a

immediately before 15 March 2023 it falls within the definition of “charity”
in Part 1 of Schedule 6 to FA 2010, and

344.10.b

at any time before that date, it has (under any enactment) made a valid claim
to His Majesty’s Revenue and Customs in reliance on its status as a charity.

344.11

The amendments made by this section are to be ignored in determining—

344.11.a

whether a person who, immediately before 15 March 2023, owns one or more
shares forming the ordinary share capital of a UK REIT is, at any later time,
an institutional investor in relation to those shares;

344.11.b

whether a person who, immediately before 15 March 2023, is a unit holder in an
exempt unauthorised unit trust is, at any later time, an eligible investor in
relation to those units;

344.11.c

whether a person who, immediately before 15 March 2023, holds a relevant
interest in—

344.11.c.i

a QAHC, or

344.11.c.ii

a company that has made an entry notification,

is, at any later time, a relevant qualifying investor in relation to that
interest.

344.12

In subsection  (11) —

344.12.a

expressions used in paragraph  (a)  have the same meaning as in Part 12 of CTA
2010 (real estate investment trusts);

344.12.b

expressions used in paragraph  (b)  have the same meaning as in the
Unauthorised Unit Trusts (Tax) Regulations 2013 ( S.I. 2013/2819 );

344.12.c

expressions used in paragraph  (c) , have the same meaning as in Schedule 2 to
FA 2022 (qualifying asset holding companies).

344.13

The following regulations were made under a power contained in paragraph 2(3)
to (5) of Schedule 6 to FA 2010 and are therefore revoked by virtue of
subsection  (1) (b) —

344.13.a

the Taxes (Definition of Charity) (Relevant Territories) Regulations 2010 (

344.13.b

after section 274ZA (as renumbered by paragraph (c)) insert—

############# Dormant pension benefits

############## Treatment of pension benefits reclaimed from reclaim fund etc

348.1.d.274ZB

348.1.d.274ZB.1

Subsection (2) applies where an amount is paid out of an authorised reclaim
fund in respect of transferred dormant eligible pension benefits.

348.1.d.274ZB.2

For the purposes of income tax and this Part, the amount paid out is to be
treated as having been paid as a consequence of a right that is the same as
the original rights, acquired as the original rights were acquired and having
the same characteristics as those rights.

348.1.d.274ZB.3

The Commissioners for His Majesty’s Revenue and Customs may make regulations
in relation to cases where—

348.1.d.274ZB.3.a

an amount is paid out of an authorised reclaim fund in respect of transferred
dormant eligible pension benefits,

348.1.d.274ZB.3.b

the registered pension scheme from which the benefits were transferred was
wound up before the payment of that amount, and

348.1.d.274ZB.3.c

the payment, or part of the payment, is treated (by virtue of subsection (2))
as being the payment by a registered pension scheme of—

348.1.d.274ZB.3.c.i

a pension protection lump sum death benefit,

348.1.d.274ZB.3.c.ii

an annuity protection lump sum death benefit,

348.1.d.274ZB.3.c.iii

a drawdown pension fund lump sum death benefit, or

348.1.d.274ZB.3.c.iv

a flexi-access drawdown fund lump sum death benefit.

348.1.d.274ZB.4

Regulations under subsection (3) may provide that a person specified in the
regulations—

348.1.d.274ZB.4.a

is to be treated as the scheme administrator for the purposes of the operation
of section 206;

348.1.d.274ZB.4.b

is responsible for the discharge of all obligations imposed on the scheme
administrator by or under this Part so far as related to the liability imposed
by that section to pay tax in respect of it.

348.1.d.274ZB.5

Regulations under subsection (3) may—

348.1.d.274ZB.5.a

make specific or general provision;

348.1.d.274ZB.5.b

make different provision for different cases.

348.1.d.274ZB.6

No liability to income tax arises in respect of income derived from
investments or deposits—

348.1.d.274ZB.6.a

that are held by an authorised reclaim fund, and

348.1.d.274ZB.6.b

that relate to an amount transferred to the authorised reclaim fund in respect
of transferred dormant eligible pension benefits.

348.1.d.274ZB.7

For the purposes of subsection (6), it does not matter when liability to
income tax on income within that subsection would otherwise arise.

348.1.d.274ZB.8

Subsection (2) of section 186 (income) applies for the purposes of subsection
(6) of this section as it applies for the purposes of subsection (1) of that
section.

348.1.d.274ZB.9

For the purposes of this section—

                                       “ authorised reclaim fund ” has the
same meaning as in the Dormant Assets Acts 2008 to 2022;
“ the original rights ” are a person’s rights against the scheme administrator
of a registered pension scheme, in respect of the benefits subsequently
transferred by the scheme administrator to an authorised reclaim fund,
immediately before the transfer;
“ transferred dormant eligible pension benefits ” means dormant eligible
pensions benefits owing to a person that have been transferred by the scheme
administrator of a registered pension scheme to an authorised reclaim fund
with the result that section 5 of the Dormant Assets Act 2022 (transfer of
eligible pension benefits to reclaim fund) applies (and references to benefits
being transferred are to be construed accordingly).

348.2

In the Inheritance Tax Act 1984, in Chapter 5 of Part 5 (miscellaneous
reliefs), after section 159 insert—

########### Dormant assets

############ Treatment of dormant assets

348.2.159A

348.2.159A.1

This section applies where there is a transfer in respect of a dormant asset.

348.2.159A.2

There is a transfer in respect of a dormant asset where an amount is
transferred by an institution in respect of an asset—

348.2.159A.2.a

to an authorised reclaim fund, with the result that section 1 of the 2008 Act
or section 2, 5, 8, 12 or 14 of the 2022 Act applies in relation to the asset,
or

348.2.159A.2.b

to an authorised reclaim fund and one or more charities, with the result that
section 2 of the 2008 Act applies in relation to the asset.

348.2.159A.3

For the purposes of this Act, rights which a person (“ P ”) acquires under
Part 1 of the 2008 Act or Part 1 or sections 22 to 25 of the 2022 Act (as the
case may be) after the transfer are to be treated as the same asset as the
original rights, acquired as the original rights were acquired and having the
same characteristics as those rights.

348.2.159A.4

For the purposes of this section—

                     “ the 2008 Act ” means the Dormant Bank and Building
Society Accounts Act 2008;
“ the 2022 Act ” means the Dormant Assets Act 2022;
“ asset ” means an asset within the scope of the dormant assets scheme (see
section 1(6) of the 2022 Act);
“ authorised reclaim fund ” has the same meaning as in the Dormant Assets Acts
2008 to 2022;
“ the original rights ” are—
in a case where—
section 8 of the 2022 Act (investment assets) applies in relation to the asset
and there has been a conversion as mentioned in section 9(3)(a) of that Act in
connection with the transfer, or
section 14 of the 2022 Act (securities assets) applies in relation to the
asset and there has been a conversion as mentioned in section 15(1)(a) of that
Act in connection with the transfer,
P’s rights against the institution immediately before that conversion;
in any other case, P’s rights against the institution immediately before the
transfer.

348.3

The amendments made by  subsection (1)  come into force on the day on which
this Act is passed.

348.4

The amendment made by  subsection (2)  is treated as having come into force on
6 June 2022.

#### Other

##### International arrangements for exchanging information

349

349.1

The Treasury may make regulations for, or in connection with, giving effect to
international tax compliance arrangements to any extent, subject to such
exceptions or modifications as the Treasury consider appropriate.

349.2

For the purposes of  this section , “ international tax compliance
arrangements ” means any provision of—

349.2.a

arrangements specified in an Order in Council made under section 173 of FA
2006 (international tax enforcement arrangements);

349.2.b

the agreement reached between the Government of the United Kingdom and the
Government of the United States of America to improve international tax
compliance and to implement the provisions commonly known as the Foreign
Account Tax Compliance Act in the enactment of the United States of America
called the Hiring Incentives to Restore Employment Act, signed on 12 September
2012;

349.2.c

the guidance on country-by-country reporting contained in the Organisation for
Economic Co-operation and Development (“ OECD ”) Guidance on Transfer Pricing
Documentation and Country-by-Country Reporting, published in 2014;

349.2.d

the OECD Standard for Automatic Exchange of Financial Account Information in
Tax Matters, published in 2014;

349.2.e

the OECD Model Mandatory Disclosure Rules for CRS Avoidance Arrangements and
Opaque Offshore Structures, published in 2018;

349.2.f

the OECD Model Rules for Reporting by Platform Operators with respect to
Sellers in the Sharing and Gig Economy, published on 3 July 2020;

349.2.g

any other arrangements or agreements made in relation to any territory or
territories outside the United Kingdom, or documents related to those
arrangements or agreements, which make provision corresponding or similar to
that made by any arrangements, agreement or document mentioned in any of
paragraphs (a)  to  (f) .

349.3

A reference in  subsection (2)  to arrangements, an agreement or another
document includes a reference to the arrangements, agreement or other document
as modified, supplemented or replaced from time to time.

349.4

Regulations under  subsection (1)  may, in particular—

349.4.a

require persons to disclose information of a specified description, including
information about arrangements that they participated in before (as well as
after) the coming into force of this section;

349.4.b

require the information to be disclosed—

349.4.b.i

to HMRC, specified persons or persons of a specified description,

349.4.b.ii

at specified times,

349.4.b.iii

in relation to specified periods of time, and

349.4.b.iv

in a specified form and manner;

349.4.c

impose other obligations on persons in connection with requirements to
disclose information, including obligations to provide information to, and
obtain information from, other specified persons;

349.4.d

provide for the imposition of penalties in respect of a contravention of, or
non-compliance with, a requirement of the regulations, including provision
about appeals in relation to the imposition of a penalty;

349.4.e

provide that a reference in the regulations to any international tax
compliance arrangements is to be read as a reference to those arrangements as
modified, supplemented or replaced from time to time;

(and for the purposes of  this subsection  “ specified ” means specified by or
under the regulations).

349.5

The regulations may—

349.5.a

make different provision for different purposes;

349.5.b

make provision by reference to things specified in a notice published by the
Commissioners (as revised or replaced from time to time) in accordance with
the regulations;

349.5.c

allow any requirement, obligation or other provision that may be imposed or
made by reference to subsection (4)(a) to (c) to be made by specific or
general direction given by the Commissioners;

349.5.d

make provision under which the Commissioners or other persons may exercise
discretions;

349.5.e

make consequential, supplementary, incidental, transitional or saving
provision (including provision amending, repealing or revoking an enactment
whenever passed or made).

349.6

For the purposes of subsections (4) and (5)—

                                    “ arrangements ” means any scheme,
transaction or series of transactions;
“ the Commissioners ” means the Commissioners for His Majesty’s Revenue and
Customs;
“ HMRC ” means His Majesty’s Revenue and Customs;
“ participate ”, in relation to arrangements, includes being involved in, or
facilitating, the arrangements in any way (for example, by receiving any
benefit from them or by designing, marketing or providing services in
connection with them, or arranging for others to do so).

349.7

The Treasury may by regulations amend the list of international tax compliance
arrangements in  subsection (2)  by—

349.7.a

adding an entry for any arrangements, agreement or document, by or under which
provision is made about the exchange of information;

349.7.b

altering or removing an entry.

349.8

Regulations under  this section  are to be made by statutory instrument.

349.9

A statutory instrument containing (whether alone or with other provision)
regulations made under  subsection (7)  may not be made unless a draft of the
instrument has been laid before, and approved by resolution of, the House of
Commons.

349.10

A statutory instrument containing any other regulations under  this section
is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of the House of Commons.

349.11

The following provisions are repealed—

349.11.a

section 222 of FA 2013;

349.11.b

section 122 of FA 2015;

349.11.c

section 84 of FA 2019;

349.11.d

section 129 of FA 2021.

349.12

Regulations made under any provision listed in  subsection (11)  are to be
treated as if they were made under  this section  (so far as that would not
otherwise be the case).

##### Payment of unclaimed money in court into the Consolidated Fund

350

In section 38(8) of the Administration of Justice Act 1982 (management and
investment of funds in court: rules), after paragraph (f) (but before the
“and” at the end) insert—

350.fa

provide for the payment of a sum of money in court into the Consolidated Fund
if—

350.fa.i

the payment is in respect of funds in court which have been vested in the
Accountant General under subsection (1) for at least 30 years, and

350.fa.ii

the conditions (if any) prescribed by the rules are met.

##### Financial sanctions regulations: prohibition on certain payments by HMRC

351

351.1

HMRC may not, at any time on or after 15 March 2023, make a payment (whether
directly or indirectly) to or for the benefit of a person who is, at that
time, a designated person for the purposes of financial sanctions regulations.

351.2

The reference in subsection (1) to a payment—

351.2.a

is a reference to a payment, including a repayment or refund, that HMRC would
(apart from that subsection) be required or permitted, by or under any
enactment, to make to the person, and

351.2.b

includes a reference to a payment that HMRC would (apart from that subsection)
be required or permitted to make to the person by way of setting off the
amount payable (as a credit) against a liability of the person to pay an
amount to HMRC (as a debit).

351.3

The reference in subsection (1) to a payment being made (directly or
indirectly) to or for the benefit of a person (“ P ”) includes the payment
being made to another person who is owned or controlled (directly or
indirectly) by P.

351.4

Nothing in this section prevents the accrual of interest, in accordance with
any enactment, on a withheld amount.

351.5

But no other supplementary amount is payable by HMRC under section 79(1)
of VATA 1994 (repayment supplement in respect of certain delayed payments or
refunds), or any other enactment, by reference to an amount that is (or was) a
withheld amount not being paid to a person on or before a particular date
(including a date falling before 15 March 2023).

351.6

Provision made by or under section 15 of SAMLA 2018 (exceptions and licences),
and by section 44 of that Act (protection for acts done for the purposes of
compliance), applies (with the necessary modifications) for the purposes of
the prohibition under subsection (1) as it applies for the purposes of
prohibitions under financial sanctions regulations.

351.7

The Treasury may by regulations made by statutory instrument—

351.7.a

specify further exceptions to the prohibition in subsection (1);

351.7.b

make such other provision as they consider appropriate for the purposes of, or
for purposes connected to, any provision made by this section.

351.8

A statutory instrument containing regulations under subsection (7) is subject
to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of the House of Commons.

351.9

References in  this section  to “financial sanctions regulations” are
references to regulations made (whether before or after the passing of this
Act) under section 1 of SAMLA 2018, so far as they make provision for or in
connection with imposing financial sanctions (within the meaning of section 3
of that Act).

351.10

In  this section —

                                    “ designated person ” has the meaning
given by section 9 of SAMLA 2018;
“ enactment ” means any provision made by or under an Act (whether before or
after the passing of this Act);
“ HMRC ” means His Majesty's Revenue and Customs;
“ SAMLA 2018 ” means the Sanctions and Anti-Money Laundering Act 2018;
“ a withheld amount ” means an amount that HMRC would, apart from this
section, be required or permitted to pay to a person.

##### Communications data

352

352.1

Section 12(2) of the Investigatory Powers Act 2016 (restriction of powers to
obtain communications data) does not apply to a power falling within
subsection (2) .

352.2

A power falls within this subsection if it is conferred (whether before, on or
after the passing of this Act) by or under—

352.2.a

any Finance Act of any year (including this Act and any other numbered Finance
Act);

352.2.b

the Taxes Acts (within the meaning of TMA 1970);

352.2.c

the customs and excise Acts (within the meaning of CEMA 1979);

352.2.d

any enactment relating to value added tax;

352.2.e

any enactment, not falling within paragraphs  (a)  to  (d) , that relates to
tax.

352.3

But  subsection (1)  does not apply in relation to the exercise of such a
power by a public authority in the course of a criminal investigation by the
authority.

352.4

In section 12 of the Investigatory Powers Act 2016, after subsection (2)
insert—

352.4.2A

Subsection (2) is subject to  section 352 (1)  of the Finance (No. 2) Act 2023
(no restriction on tax related powers).

352.5

In Schedule 36 to FA 2008 (information and inspection powers), in paragraph
19, omit sub-paragraphs (4) and (5).

352.6

In consequence of the repeal made by  subsection (5) , omit paragraph 10 of
Schedule 2 to the Investigatory Powers Act 2016.

352.7

The modification and amendments made by  subsections (1)  to  (6)  are to be
treated as having always had effect.

352.8

Subsections  (9)  and  (10)  apply where—

352.8.a

before the day on which this Act is passed, a public authority imposed a
requirement on a person under a power falling within  subsection (2) , and

352.8.b

as a result of section 12(2) of the Investigatory Powers Act 2016 the public
authority did not, ignoring this section, have the power to impose it.

352.9

The requirement is to be treated as having been imposed on the day on which
this Act is passed (and accordingly the period in which it must be complied
with is to be treated as starting on that day) unless—

352.9.a

the requirement was withdrawn by the public authority before that day, or

352.9.b

the person complied with the requirement before that day.

352.10

Where, before the day on which this Act is passed, the public authority
imposed a penalty on the person for contravening the requirement—

352.10.a

the penalty is of no effect, and

352.10.b

if already paid, the authority is liable to repay it.

3.5

After section 1126 insert—

############ Attributable expenditure: special rules for data and cloud computing

3.5.1126ZA

3.5.1126ZA.1

Expenditure on data licences or cloud computing services is not to be treated
as attributable to relevant research and development if, in connection with
the grant of a licence or the provision of a service, a relevant person
obtains—

3.5.1126ZA.1.a

a right to sell data in respect of which the licence is granted or the service
is provided (as the case may be);

3.5.1126ZA.1.b

a right to publish, share or otherwise communicate data in respect of which
the licence is granted or the service is provided (as the case may be) to a
third party, other than for the purposes of communications reasonably
necessary for, or incidental to, the purposes of the relevant research and
development.

3.5.1126ZA.2

Expenditure on data licences or cloud computing services is not to be treated
as attributable to relevant research and development so far as it is
attributable to a qualifying indirect activity.

3.5.1126ZA.3

In this section—

                     “ qualifying indirect activity ” means an activity
mentioned in paragraph 31 of the Guidelines on the Meaning of Research and
Development for Tax Purposes issued on 7 March 2023 and as amended from time
to time;
“ relevant person ” has the meaning given in section 1126A(10).

3.6

In section 1126A (attributable expenditure: special rules), in the heading,
after “special rules” insert  “for consumable items” .

3.7

In section 1126B (attributable expenditure: further provision)—

3.7.a

in subsection (1)—

3.7.a.i

after “expenditure on” insert  “data licences, cloud computing services or” ;

3.7.a.ii

after “1126” insert  “, 1126ZA” ;

3.7.b

in subsection (2)—

3.7.b.i

in paragraph (a), after “expenditure on” insert  “data licences, cloud
computing services or” ;

3.7.b.ii

in paragraph (b), after “in which” insert  “data licences, cloud computing
services or” ;

3.7.c

in subsection (4), after paragraph (a) insert—

3.7.c.aa

section 1126ZA ;

.

Schedule 18 to FA 1998 (company tax returns, assessments and related matters)

The provisions of paragraphs 41 and 45 to 48 relating to discovery assessments

11.b.2A.a

###### Time limits for R&D claims

12

For paragraph 83E (time limit for claims) substitute—

12.83E

12.83E.1

Except where  sub-paragraph (3)  applies, a claim to which this Part of this
Schedule applies may be made, amended or withdrawn at any time up to the last
day of the period of—

12.83E.1.a

two years beginning with the last day of the period of account, in a case
where the period of account to which the claim relates is not longer than 18
months, or

12.83E.1.b

42 months beginning with the first day of the period of account, in any other
case.

12.83E.2

Sub-paragraph (3)  applies where—

12.83E.2.a

a company makes a claim for R&D tax relief under Part 13 of the Corporation
Tax Act 2009,

12.83E.2.b

the company is not entitled to the relief, and

12.83E.2.c

an officer of Revenue and Customs exercises the power under paragraph 34(2)(b)
or (2A) to make an amendment by removing the claim from the company tax return
in which it is made.

12.83E.3

The company may make, amend or withdraw a claim for R&D expenditure credit
under Chapter 6A of Part 3 of the Corporation Tax Act 2009 in respect of
eligible expenditure at any time up to whichever is the last of the following
dates—

12.83E.3.a

30 days after notice of the amendment mentioned in  sub-paragraph (2) (c)  is
issued;

12.83E.3.b

if an appeal is brought against that amendment, 30 days after the date on
which the appeal is finally determined.

12.83E.4

In this paragraph “ eligible expenditure ” means expenditure—

12.83E.4.a

to which the claim mentioned in  sub-paragraph (2) (a)  relates, and

12.83E.4.b

in respect of which the company is entitled to R&D expenditure credit.

12.83E.5

A claim to which this Part of this Schedule applies may be made, amended or
withdrawn after the end of the period mentioned in  sub-paragraph (1)  or  (3)
(as the case may be) if an officer of Revenue and Customs allows it.

###### Requirement to provide additional information in relation to R&D claims

13

In Part 9A (company tax returns etc: claims for R&D expenditure credits or R&D
tax relief), after paragraph 83E (substituted by  paragraph 12 ) insert—

########## Additional information to be provided in relation to claim

13.83EA

13.83EA.1

A claim to which this Part of this Schedule applies is invalid unless the
claimant company has provided information to an officer of Revenue and Customs
in accordance with regulations under  sub-paragraph (2)  not later than the
date on which the claim is made or amended by the company in accordance with
paragraph 83E.

13.83EA.2

The Commissioners for Revenue and Customs may by regulations specify, in
relation to a claim to which this Part of this Schedule applies—

13.83EA.2.a

information to be provided by the claimant company;

13.83EA.2.b

the form and manner in which the information is to be provided.

###### Power of HMRC to remove R&D claims made in error from return

14

In Part 9A (claims for R&D expenditure credits or R&D tax relief), after
paragraph 83EA (inserted by  paragraph 13 ) insert—

########## Removal from return of claims made in error

14.83EB

14.83EB.1

This paragraph applies, in relation to a claim to which this Part of this
Schedule applies (the “original claim”), where an officer of Revenue and
Customs—

14.83EB.1.a

reasonably believes that a claimant company has failed to comply with a
requirement relating to the making of the claim (and accordingly that the
claim has been made in error), and

14.83EB.1.b

exercises the power under paragraph 16(1) to make a correction by removing the
claim from the company tax return in which it is made.

14.83EB.2

Sub-paragraphs (4) and (5) of paragraph 16 do not apply in relation to the
correction (and accordingly the claimant company may not reject the
correction).

14.83EB.3

The claimant company may, within 90 days beginning with the date of the notice
issued under paragraph 16(3), send written representations to an officer of
Revenue and Customs objecting to the notice on the grounds that a matter
stated in the notice was incorrect.

14.83EB.4

An officer of Revenue and Customs must consider any representations made under
sub-paragraph (3) .

14.83EB.5

Having considered the representations, the officer must determine whether to—

14.83EB.5.a

confirm the notice, or

14.83EB.5.b

withdraw the notice,

and must notify the claimant company accordingly.

14.83EB.6

Nothing in  sub-paragraph (2)  prevents the claimant company from amending its
company tax return to make a new claim to which this Part of this Schedule
would apply in respect of the expenditure to which the original claim related
(but see  sub-paragraph (7) ).

14.83EB.7

Where, in relation to the original claim—

14.83EB.7.a

a claim notification (within the meaning of  section 1142A  of the Corporation
Tax Act 2009) was required to be made, and

14.83EB.7.b

no claim notification was made,

the company may not make a new claim to which this Part of this Schedule would
apply in respect of the expenditure to which the original claim related.

##### Miscellaneous amendments

###### Amendment of CTA 2009

15

CTA 2009 is amended as follows.

###### R&D tax relief: circumstances in which enterprises are treated as SMEs

16

16.1

In section 1119—

16.1.a

in subsection (1), at the end insert  “(and see  sections 1120A  and  1120B )”
;

16.1.b

in subsection (2), for “section 1120” substitute  “ sections 1120 to  1120B ”
.

16.2

In section 1120 (qualifications to section 1119)—

16.2.a

after subsection (6) insert—

16.2.a.6A

This section is subject to  sections 1120A  and  1120B .

;

16.2.b

in subsection (7), in the words before paragraph (a), after “section” insert
“and in  sections 1120A  and  1120B ” .

16.3

After that section insert—

############ Enterprise treated as an SME where related enterprise becomes large

16.3.1120A

16.3.1120A.1

This section applies, in relation to an accounting period, where the following
conditions are met.

16.3.1120A.2

The first condition is that, for the duration of the accounting period, an
enterprise (“ E ”) is related to a partner enterprise or linked enterprise (“
F ”).

16.3.1120A.3

The second condition is that, at the start of the accounting period, both E
and F are small or medium-sized enterprises.

16.3.1120A.4

The third condition is that, at the end of the accounting period, E is not a
small or medium-sized enterprise by reason only that F has, during the
accounting period, exceeded the employee limit or either of the financial
limits.

16.3.1120A.5

Both E and F are to be treated as if they were small or medium-sized
enterprises for the accounting period.

############ Enterprise treated as an SME where acquired by an SME

16.3.1120B

16.3.1120B.1

This section applies, in relation to an accounting period, where the following
conditions are met.

16.3.1120B.2

The first condition is that, at the start of the accounting period, an
enterprise (“ E ”) was not a small or medium-sized enterprise by reason only
that a partner enterprise or linked enterprise to which E was related exceeded
the employee limit or either of the financial limits.

16.3.1120B.3

The second condition is that, during the accounting period, control of E was
acquired by a company that, at the time of the acquisition, was a small or
medium-sized enterprise.

16.3.1120B.4

E is to be treated as if it were a small or medium-sized enterprise for the
accounting period.

16.3.1120B.5

In  subsection (3)  “ control ” has the same meaning as in section 1124 of CTA
2010.

###### Accounts treated as prepared on going concern basis

17

17.1

In section 104T (R&D expenditure credits: “going concern”), after subsection
(4) insert—

17.1.4A

For the purposes of this section, where a company (“ A ”) is a member of the
same group as another company (“ B ”) and A’s latest published accounts were
not prepared on a going concern basis by reason only of a relevant group
transfer, the accounts are to be treated as if they were prepared on a going
concern basis.

17.1.4B

For the purposes of this section a “relevant group transfer” is a transfer
within the accounting period to which the latest published accounts relate by
A of its trade and research and development to another member of the group
mentioned in  subsection (4A) .

17.2

In section 1046 (R&D relief for SMEs: relief only available where company is
going concern), after subsection (2C) insert—

17.2.2D

For the purposes of this section, where a company (“ A ”) is a member of the
same group as another company (“ B ”) and A’s latest published accounts were
not prepared on a going concern basis by reason only of a relevant group
transfer, the accounts are to be treated as if they were prepared on a going
concern basis.

17.2.2E

For the purposes of this section—

17.2.2E.a

a “relevant group transfer” is a transfer, within the accounting period to
which the latest published accounts relate, by A of its trade and research and
development to another member of the group mentioned in  subsection (2D) ;

17.2.2E.b

A and B are members of the same group if they are members of the same group of
companies for the purposes of Part 5 of CTA 2010 (group relief).

17.3

In section 1057 (R&D relief for SMEs: tax credit only available where company
is a going concern), after subsection (4C) insert—

17.3.4D

For the purposes of this section, where a company (“ A ”) is a member of the
same group as another company (“ B ”) and A’s latest published accounts were
not prepared on a going concern basis by reason only of a relevant group
transfer, the accounts are to be treated as if they were prepared on a going
concern basis.

17.3.4E

For the purposes of this section—

17.3.4E.a

a “relevant group transfer” is a transfer, within the accounting period to
which the latest published accounts relate, by A of its trade and research and
development to another member of the group mentioned in  subsection (4D) ;

17.3.4E.b

A and B are members of the same group if they are members of the same group of
companies for the purposes of Part 5 of CTA 2010 (group relief).

References in this Part to expenditure incurred on payments (however

###### Income tax

####### The applicable rate for grossing up basic amounts of estate income

1

1.1

Chapter 6 of Part 5 of ITTOIA 2005 (beneficiaries’ income from estates in
administration) is amended as follows.

1.2

In section 656 (income charged: UK estates), in subsection (2) omit “for that
year”.

1.3

In section 657 (income charged: foreign estates), in subsection (3) omit “for
that year”.

1.4

For section 663 (the applicable rate for grossing up basic amounts of estate
income) substitute—

############# The applicable rate for grossing up basic amounts of estate income

1.4.663

1.4.663.1

The applicable rate by reference to which a basic amount of estate income is
grossed up for the purposes of sections 656 and 657 depends on the rate at
which income tax was borne by the parts of the aggregate income of the estate
from which section 679 treats the basic amount as having been paid.

1.4.663.2

If the same rate was borne by all of the income from which section 679 treats
the basic amount as having been paid, the applicable rate is that rate.

1.4.663.3

If different rates were borne by different parts of the income from which
section 679 treats the basic amount as having been paid, each of those rates
is the applicable rate by reference to which the corresponding part of the
basic amount is grossed up.

####### The applicable rate for grossing up for determining shares in an estate in the final tax year

2

2.1

Chapter 6 of Part 5 of ITTOIA 2005 (beneficiaries’ income from estates in
administration) is amended as follows.

2.2

In section 668 (reduction in share of residuary income of estate)—

2.2.a

in subsection (1), in paragraph (b), for “(grossed up where subsection (5)
applies)” substitute  “grossed up, where the estate is a UK estate, by the
applicable rate (see  subsections (5A)  to  (5C) )” ;

2.2.b

for subsection (5) substitute—

2.2.b.5A

The applicable rate by reference to which a sum within subsection (1)(b) is
grossed up depends on the rate at which income tax was borne by the parts of
the aggregate income of the estate from which  section 679A  treats the sum as
having been paid.

2.2.b.5B

If the same rate was borne by all the income from which  section 679A  treats
the sum as having been paid, the applicable rate is that rate.

2.2.b.5C

If different rates were borne by different parts of the income from which
section 679A  treats the sum as having been paid, each of those rates is the
applicable rate by reference to which the corresponding part of the sum is
grossed up.

2.3

After section 679 insert—

############# Income from which sums within section 668(1)(b) are treated as paid

2.3.679A

2.3.679A.1

The part of the aggregate income of the estate from which a sum within section
668(1)(b) is treated as paid is determined by applying assumptions A and B in
that order.

2.3.679A.2

Assumption A is that if there are different persons with an absolute interest
in the residue of the estate, such apportionments of the aggregate income of
the estate in respect of those interests are to be made as are just and
reasonable for the different interests.

2.3.679A.3

Assumption B is that sums are paid from the income to which a person’s share
of the residuary estate relates in descending order, starting with the income
bearing income tax at the highest rate and ending with the income bearing
income tax at the lowest rate.

2.3.679A.4

If some, but not all, of the aggregate income of the estate is income within
section 680, assumption C is applied before assumptions A and B.

2.3.679A.5

Assumption C is that the basic amount is paid from income that is not within
section 680 before it is paid from income within that section.

2.3.679A.6

Assumptions A and B then apply—

2.3.679A.6.a

first to determine the part of the income not within that section from which
the basic amount is paid, and

2.3.679A.6.b

then to determine the part of the income within that section from which the
basic amount is paid.

2.4

In section 680 (income treated as bearing income tax), in subsection (1)—

2.4.a

omit the “and” at the end of the entry for section 670;

2.4.b

at the end insert

, and

      section 679A  (income from which sums within section 668(1)(b) are
treated as paid).

##### Low income trusts and estates

###### Income tax

####### Low income estates and trusts: tax liability of personal representatives and trustees

10

10.1

Chapter 3 of Part 2 of ITA 2007 (calculation of income tax liability) is
amended as follows.

10.2

In section 23 (the calculation of income tax liability), at the end of Step 2
insert—

                                            See also  section 24B  which
provides that a taxpayer’s net income is taken to be £0 in certain cases.

10.3

After section 24A insert—

############# Calculation of net income at Step 2 for low income estates and trusts

10.3.24B

10.3.24B.1

Subsection (2)  applies in relation to a taxpayer if—

10.3.24B.1.a

they are the personal representative of a deceased person and, ignoring this
section, their net income in that capacity at the end of Step 2 of the
calculation in section 23 would be equal to or less than the de minimis
estates amount, or

10.3.24B.1.b

they are the trustee of a settlement (“the relevant settlement”) and, ignoring
this section, their net income in that capacity at the end of that Step would
be equal to or less than the de minimis trusts amount.

10.3.24B.2

The taxpayer’s net income in their capacity as a personal representative of a
deceased person or trustee of a settlement (as the case may be) at the end of
Step 2 of the calculation in section 23 is taken to be £0.

10.3.24B.3

The de minimis estates amount is £500.

10.3.24B.4

The de minimis trusts amount is—

10.3.24B.4.a

£500, or

10.3.24B.4.b

in a case where  subsection (5)  applies, the higher of—

10.3.24B.4.b.i

£100, and

10.3.24B.4.b.ii

the settlor’s threshold amount.

10.3.24B.5

This subsection applies where—

10.3.24B.5.a

the settlor in relation to the relevant settlement is also the settlor in
relation to one or more qualifying settlements,

10.3.24B.5.b

ignoring this section, the trust rate income (within the meaning of Part 9)
for the tax year of the trustees of the relevant settlement would be greater
than £0, and

10.3.24B.5.c

the relevant settlement is a settlement in respect of which each of the
conditions mentioned in  subsection (9)  is met throughout the tax year.

10.3.24B.6

The settlor’s threshold amount is the amount given by—

£ 500 QS + 1       where QS is the total number of qualifying settlements.

10.3.24B.7

If there is more than one settlor in relation to the relevant settlement—

10.3.24B.7.a

calculate the threshold amount of each of them, and

10.3.24B.7.b

use the lowest of those threshold amounts for the purposes of  subsection (4)
(b) (ii) .

10.3.24B.8

A settlement is a “qualifying settlement” if—

10.3.24B.8.a

it is not the relevant settlement,

10.3.24B.8.b

it is in existence at a time during the tax year,

10.3.24B.8.c

ignoring this section, the trust rate income (within the meaning of Part 9)
for the tax year of the trustees of the settlement would be greater than £0,
and

10.3.24B.8.d

it is a settlement in respect of which each of the conditions mentioned in
subsection (9)  is met throughout the tax year.

10.3.24B.9

The conditions are—

10.3.24B.9.a

the property comprised in the settlement is not held for a pensions purpose
within the meaning of paragraph 7(3) of Schedule 1C to TCGA 1992 (property
comprised in settlements held for a pensions purpose);

10.3.24B.9.b

no income arising under the settlement is treated as the income of the settlor
as a result of section 624 of ITTOIA 2005 (income where settlor retains an
interest);

10.3.24B.9.c

the settlement is not a qualifying trust within the meaning of section 34 or
35 of FA 2005 (trusts for the benefit of disabled persons or relevant minors);

10.3.24B.9.d

the settlement is not a heritage maintenance settlement within the meaning of
Chapter 10 of Part 9 (heritage maintenance settlements) (see section 507(2)
and (3)).

16

After section 438 insert—

########## Application of section 438: certain creditors treated as qualifying infrastructure companies

16.438A

16.438A.1

This section applies where—

16.438A.1.a

a company (“ C ”), at a time in the period mentioned in subsection (1) of
section 438—

16.438A.1.a.i

is a member of the worldwide group of which the qualifying infrastructure
company mentioned in that subsection is a member, but

16.438A.1.a.ii

is not a UK group company; and

16.438A.1.b

C is a creditor in relation to an amount which—

16.438A.1.b.i

is a relevant loan relationship debit (as defined in section 383) for the
debtor company, or

16.438A.1.b.ii

would be a relevant loan relationship debit if the debtor company were UK
resident.

16.438A.2

For the purposes of section 438, C is treated in relation to the amount
mentioned in subsection (1)(b) (the “relevant loan amount”) as a qualifying
infrastructure company if—

16.438A.2.a

throughout the period mentioned in section 438(1), C—

16.438A.2.a.i

meets the public infrastructure income test for the accounting period (see
subsections (2) to (4) of section 433) and subsection (3) of this section),
and

16.438A.2.a.ii

meets the public infrastructure assets test for the accounting period (see
subsections (5) to (10) of that section and subsection (4) of this section),

(but does not satisfy the conditions in subsection (1)(c) and (d) of section
433);

16.438A.2.b

the loan to which the relevant loan amount relates (the “relevant loan”) is
fully funded by another loan (the “corresponding loan”) made to C for that
purpose and on substantially the same terms as the relevant loan; and

16.438A.2.c

amounts arising to C in respect of the corresponding loan would, if section
438(2) applied to C, qualify as “exempt amounts” within the meaning of that
subsection.

16.438A.3

For the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(i), C is also treated as meeting the
public infrastructure income test for an accounting period if all, or all but
an insignificant proportion, of its income for the period derives from—

16.438A.3.a

anything listed in any of paragraphs (a) to (c) of section 433(2),

16.438A.3.b

shares in, or debt issued by, a company that meets the test in section 433(2)
for that period,

16.438A.3.c

shares in or debt issued by a company that is treated as meeting the public
infrastructure income test for that period by reason of this subsection.

16.438A.4

For the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(ii), C is also treated as meeting the
public infrastructure assets test for an accounting period if all, or all but
an insignificant proportion, of the total value of the company's assets
recognised in an appropriate balance sheet on each day in that period derives
from—

16.438A.4.a

anything listed in any of paragraphs (a) to (e) of section 433(5),

16.438A.4.b

shares in, or debt issued by, a company that meets the test in section 433(5)
for that period,

16.438A.4.c

shares in or debt issued by a company that is treated as meeting the public
infrastructure assets test for that period by reason of this subsection.

16.438A.5

For the purposes of determining whether amounts arising to C would qualify as
exempt amounts under section 438(2) (for the purposes of subsection (2)(c) of
this section), the recourse of a creditor is treated as being limited to
relevant infrastructure matters if, in the event that C fails to perform its
obligations in question, the recourse of the creditor is limited to—

16.438A.5.a

anything listed in paragraphs (a) to (c) of section 438(4),

16.438A.5.b

shares in or debt issued by a company whose income and assets consist wholly
of income and assets within those paragraphs,

16.438A.5.c

shares in or debt issued by a company whose income and assets consist wholly
of income and assets within paragraphs (a) or (b) of this subsection, or

16.438A.5.d

shares in or debt issued by a company whose income and assets consists wholly
of income and assets within paragraphs (a) to (c) of this subsection, and so
on.

16.438A.6

For the purposes of subsection (5), in determining whether a company’s income
and assets consists wholly of income and assets of a particular description,
any source of income or any asset is ignored if, having regard to all the
circumstances, it is reasonable to regard as insignificant the amount of
income arising from the source, or (as the case may be) the value of the asset
recognised, in the accounting period.

##### Tax treatment of financing costs and income

37

This Part of this Schedule applies if—

37.a

a company (“ C ”) was, for the purposes of Part 7 of TIOPA 2010, a member of a
worldwide group in a period of account of the group beginning before 1 April
2017,

37.b

the reporting body has, in relation to that period of account, submitted—

37.b.i

a statement of disallowances under section 278 or 279 of TIOPA 2010, and

37.b.ii

a statement of allocated exemptions under section 290 or 291 of that Act,

37.c

after the submission of the statement mentioned in sub-paragraph (b), the
total disallowed amount of the worldwide group for that period of account is
reduced (as a result of an enquiry into C’s company tax for a relevant
accounting period or otherwise),

37.d

as a result of the reduction in the total disallowed amount, the sum of the
amounts specified in the statement of allocated exemptions under section
292(4)(b) of TIOPA 2010 exceeds the limit specified in section 292(6) of that
Act,

37.e

on or after 15 March 2023, the reporting body submits a revised statement of
disallowances under section 279 of TIOPA 2010, and

37.f

the revised statement of disallowances is treated, under regulation 13 of the
2009 Regulations, as if it had been received by HMRC by the time specified in
section 279(2) of TIOPA 2010.

38

38.1

Part 7 of TIOPA 2010 has effect in relation to the worldwide group as if the
revised statement of disallowances had not been submitted unless—

38.1.a

on or after 15 March 2023, the reporting body also submits a revised statement
of allocated exemptions under section 291 of TIOPA 2010, and

38.1.b

the revised statement of allocated exemptions is treated, under regulation 28
of the 2009 Regulations or under sub-paragraph (2), as if it had been received
by HMRC by the time specified in section 291(2) of TIOPA 2010.

38.2

Where the revised statement of allocated exemptions mentioned in sub-paragraph
(1)(a) is received by HMRC before the end of the period of 30 days beginning
with the day on which this Act comes into force, it is treated for the
purposes of this Part (and of the application of Part 7 of TIOPA 2010 for the
purposes of this Part) as if it had been received by HMRC by the time
specified in section 291(2) of TIOPA 2010.

38.3

If the revised statement of disallowances referred to in  paragraph 37 (e)
specifies that no financing expense amounts for the relevant period of account
are to be disallowed, the requirement in section 280(4) of TIOPA 2010 does not
apply in relation to the statement.

38.4

If the revised statement of allocated exemptions referred to in  sub-paragraph
(1) (a)  specifies that no financing income amounts for the relevant period of
account are to be exempted, the requirement in section 292(4) of TIOPA 2010
does not apply in relation to the statement.

39

For the purposes of this Part (and of the application of Part 7 of TIOPA 2010
for the purposes of this Part) references to the “ reporting body ” include
references to C unless—

39.a

the ultimate parent of the worldwide group notifies HMRC that another company
is the reporting body for those purposes,

39.b

the other company is—

39.b.i

for the purposes of  paragraph 37 , a company to which Chapter 3 of Part 7 of
TIOPA 2010 applies, or

39.b.ii

for the purposes of  paragraph 38 (1) , a company to which Chapter 4 of Part 7
of TIOPA 2010 applies, and

39.c

the notice is given before the end of the period within which the revised
statement of disallowances mentioned in  paragraph 37 (f)  would be treated,
under regulation 13 of the 2009 Regulations, as if it had been received by
HMRC by the time specified in section 279(2) of TIOPA 2010.

40

40.1

References in this Part to any provision of Part 7 of TIOPA 2010, or of the
2009 Regulations, are references to that provision as it continues to have
effect in relation to—

40.1.a

periods of account of the worldwide group ending before 1 April 2017, and

40.1.b

where financial statements of the worldwide group are drawn up in respect of a
period that begins before, and ends on or after, 1 April 2017, the period—

40.1.b.i

beginning at the time the straddling period of account (as defined in
paragraph 26(3)(b) of Schedule 5 to F(No.2)A 2017) begins, and

40.1.b.ii

ending with 31 March 2017.

40.2

In this Part, the “ 2009 Regulations ” means the Corporation Tax (Financing
Costs and Income) Regulations 2009 ( S.I. 2009/3173 ).

40.3

Terms used in this Part and in Part 7 of TIOPA 2010 have the same meaning as
in that Part of that Act.

############ Partial gross payment of distributions to partnerships

6.2.7A

6.2.7A.1

This regulation applies to the payment of a relevant distribution by a company
if—

6.2.7A.1.a

the company reasonably believes that the recipient is a partnership whose
partners include a person or body—

6.2.7A.1.a.i

to which paragraph (2) or (3) of regulation 7 applies, or

6.2.7A.1.a.ii

to which paragraph (4) of that regulation applies where the partner’s share of
the partnership profits are to be applied for the purposes of the fund,
scheme, account or plan in respect of which that partner has duties,

6.2.7A.1.b

the company has a reasonable belief as to the share of partnership profits
that each partner is entitled to,

6.2.7A.1.c

the company reasonably believes that arrangements exist that will result in
each partner’s share of the partnership profits reflecting whether or not tax
was deducted in relation to that partner (as a result of regulation 3(2) and
this regulation), and

6.2.7A.1.d

the company elects to make the payment in accordance with paragraph  (2)  (by
making it in accordance with that paragraph).

6.2.7A.2

The relevant proportion of the relevant distribution is to be paid without
deduction of income tax.

6.2.7A.3

The relevant proportion is equal to the sum of the shares of the partnership
profits (expressed as proportions) to which each partner who falls within
paragraph (1) (a) (i)  or  (ii)  is entitled.

6.2.7A.4

But—

6.2.7A.4.a

paragraph  (2)  is subject to the qualification in paragraph (7) of regulation
7, and

6.2.7A.4.b

if the company’s belief as to any of the matters referred to in paragraph  (1)
is incorrect, these Regulations apply to the payment as if it were never one
to which this regulation applied.

6.2.7A.5

Upon discovering that a payment that was made in accordance with paragraph
(2)  should not have been made in accordance with that paragraph (as a result
of paragraph  (4)  or otherwise), the company who made it must deliver an
amended return in accordance with regulation 11.

6.2.7A.6

Where this paragraph applies to the payment of a relevant distribution, the
company making it must (in addition to its duty under regulation 6(1)) furnish
the partnership with a statement in writing in respect of each partner that is
not a partner who falls within  paragraph (1) (a) (i)  or  (ii)  showing the
amount of tax deducted in relation to each such partner.

6.2.7A.7

The duty imposed by paragraph  (6)  is enforceable at the suit or instance of
the partnership.

6.3

In regulation 3(2) (deduction of tax), after “regulation 7” insert  “or 7A” .
