############ Requirement to give notice to the Secretary of State in certain cases

2.5.12A

2.5.12A.1

This paragraph applies where the TRA proposes to make a final negative
determination.

2.5.12A.2

The TRA must notify the Secretary of State of its proposed determination.

2.5.12A.3

Where the Secretary of State has been notified in accordance with sub-
paragraph  (2) , the Secretary of State may, within the relevant period (and
subject to sub-paragraph  (4) ), request that the TRA reassess its proposed
determination by reference to any matters specified in the request.

2.5.12A.4

The Secretary of State may only make a request under sub-paragraph  (3)  where
the Secretary of State considers that—

2.5.12A.4.a

there is information that the TRA did not take into account in its
investigation that is relevant to the proposed determination,

2.5.12A.4.b

the TRA has made an error in relation to its proposed determination, or

2.5.12A.4.c

exceptional circumstances make the request appropriate.

2.5.12A.5

The TRA must comply with a request under sub-paragraph  (3) .

2.5.12A.6

The TRA may not make its proposed determination until—

2.5.12A.6.a

the relevant period has ended, or

2.5.12A.6.b

if the Secretary of State informs the TRA within the relevant period that the
Secretary of State will not make a request under sub-paragraph  (3) , the time
when the TRA receives that information.

2.5.12A.7

For the purposes of this paragraph, the relevant period is the period of 21
days beginning with the day on which the TRA notifies the Secretary of State
that it proposes to make the determination.

the recommendation, or

###### Revocation in the public interest

6

After paragraph 22 insert—

########## Revocation in the public interest

6.22A

6.22A.1

The Secretary of State may decide to revoke the application of an anti-dumping
amount or a countervailing amount to goods in the absence of a recommendation
from the TRA where the Secretary of State considers that it is in the public
interest to do so.

6.22A.2

Before making a decision under sub-paragraph  (1)  the Secretary of State must
consult such persons as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.

6.22A.3

Where the Secretary of State makes a decision under sub-paragraph (1), the
Secretary of State—

6.22A.3.a

must publish notice of the decision,

6.22A.3.b

must notify interested parties (see paragraph 32(3)) accordingly,

6.22A.3.c

must lay a statement before the House of Commons setting out the reasons for
making the decision, and

6.22A.3.d

is required under section 13 to make provision by public notice to give effect
to the decision.

7.22B.1.a

In paragraph 11 (TRA’s duty to recommend a provisional safeguarding amount or

10.1.a

(a));

10.1.b

after sub-paragraph (8) insert—

10.1.b.8A

Where the TRA makes a recommendation under sub-paragraph (3), it must advise
the Secretary of State whether and why it considers that applying a
provisional safeguarding amount to relevant goods, or making relevant goods
subject to a provisional tariff rate quota, in accordance with the
recommendation, would meet the economic interest test (see paragraph 23).

10.2

In paragraph 14 (Secretary of State’s power to apply a provisional
safeguarding amount)—

10.2.a

in sub-paragraph (2), for paragraphs (a) and (b) (and the “—” before paragraph
(a)) substitute  “it is not in the public interest to accept it.” ;

10.2.b

after sub-paragraph (2) insert—

10.2.b.2A

In considering that, the Secretary of State must have regard to the TRA’s
advice on whether applying a provisional safeguard amount to relevant goods in
accordance with the recommendation would meet the economic interest test (see
paragraph 23).

10.2.b.2B

Sub-paragraph (2C) applies if the recommendation is rejected.

10.2.b.2C

If the Secretary of State considers that it is in the public interest to do
so, the Secretary of State may decide that—

10.2.b.2C.a

a provisional safeguarding amount should be applied to all the relevant goods,
or to specified relevant goods, other than in accordance with the
recommendation, or

10.2.b.2C.b

all the relevant goods, or specified relevant goods, should be subject to a
provisional tariff rate quota for a specified period.

10.2.b.2D

But the Secretary of State may make a decision under sub-paragraph (2C) only
if a recommendation under paragraph 11(3) to the same effect as the decision
(ignoring any restrictions in paragraph 11 on the ability of the TRA to make
such a recommendation) would have complied with the requirements set out in
paragraph 12 or 13, as the case may be.

10.2.b.2E

Where the Secretary of State makes a decision under sub-paragraph (2C), the
Secretary of State—

10.2.b.2E.a

must publish notice of the decision,

10.2.b.2E.b

must notify interested parties (see paragraph 31(3)) accordingly,

10.2.b.2E.c

must lay a statement before the House of Commons setting out the reasons for
making the decision, and

10.2.b.2E.d

is required under section 13 to make provision by public notice to give effect
to the decision.

;

10.2.c

in sub-paragraph (3), after “rejected” insert  “and the Secretary of State
does not make a decision under sub-paragraph (2C)” .

###### Definitive remedies

11

11.1

In paragraph 16 (TRA’s duty to recommend a definitive safeguarding amount or
tariff rate quota)—

11.1.a

omit sub-paragraph (5)(a) (and the “and” at the end of that sub-paragraph);

11.1.b

after sub-paragraph (10) insert—

11.1.b.10A

Where the TRA considers that there are two or more options which it could
recommend under sub-paragraph (3)(a) or (b), in relation to relevant goods or
descriptions of relevant goods, it may give the Secretary of State each of
those options as part of its recommendation.

11.1.b.10B

The Secretary of State may by regulations make provision requiring the TRA, in
specified circumstances, to consider whether it could give the Secretary of
State two or more options as part of its recommendation under sub-paragraph
(3)(a) or (b) in relation to relevant goods or descriptions of relevant goods.

11.1.b.10C

Where, after considering whether it could give the Secretary of State two or
more options as part of its recommendation in accordance with regulations
under sub-paragraph  (10B) , the TRA considers that there is only one option
which it could reasonably recommend under sub-paragraph (3)(a) or (b) in
relation to relevant goods or descriptions of relevant goods, it must give the
Secretary of State its reasons for reaching that conclusion.

11.1.b.10D

Where the TRA gives the Secretary of State options, it must—

11.1.b.10D.a

give the Secretary of State its reasons for including each option, and

11.1.b.10D.b

inform the Secretary of State which option it prefers and why.

11.1.b.10E

Where the TRA makes a recommendation under sub-paragraph (3) it must advise
the Secretary of State whether and why it considers that applying a definitive
safeguarding amount or making relevant goods subject to a quota in accordance
with—

11.1.b.10E.a

its recommendation, or

11.1.b.10E.b

where the recommendation contains options given under sub-paragraph (10A),
each option,

would meet the economic interest test (see paragraph 23).

amount)—

paragraph 16(10A) as it has effect in relation to a recommendation by the TRA
under paragraph 16(3)(a).

11.5.g.4A.a

11.5.g.4A.b

11.5.g.4A.c

exceptional circumstances make the request appropriate.

###### Revocation in the public interest

13

After paragraph 22 insert—

########## Revocation in the public interest

13.22A

13.22A.1

The Secretary of State may decide that the application of a definitive
safeguarding amount to goods, or a tariff rate quota to which goods are
subject, is to be revoked in the absence of a recommendation from the TRA
where the Secretary of State considers that revocation is in the public
interest.

13.22A.2

Before making a decision under sub-paragraph  (1)  the Secretary of State must
consult such persons as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.

13.22A.3

Where the Secretary of State makes a decision under sub-paragraph (1), the
Secretary of State—

13.22A.3.a

must publish notice of the decision,

13.22A.3.b

must notify interested parties (see paragraph 31(3)) accordingly,

13.22A.3.c

must lay a statement before the House of Commons setting out the reasons for
making the decision, and

13.22A.3.d

is required under section 13 to make provision by public notice to give effect
to the decision.

###### Power to request assistance etc

14

After paragraph 22A (as inserted by paragraph  13 ) insert—

########## Power to request assistance etc

14.22B

14.22B.1

The Secretary of State may request that the TRA give advice, information or
other support to the Secretary of State for the purpose of allowing the
Secretary of State to decide whether to make a decision under any of the
following—

14.22B.1.a

paragraphs 14(2C) and 15(2C) (decisions to adopt a provisional remedy other
than in accordance with a recommendation);

14.22B.1.b

paragraphs 19(2C) and 20(2C) (decisions to adopt a final remedy other than in
accordance with a recommendation);

14.22B.1.c

paragraph 22A(1) (decision to revoke a final remedy in the absence of a
recommendation).

14.22B.2

The Secretary of State may include in a request under sub-paragraph  (1)  a
requirement that the TRA investigate and provide a report on any matter
specified in the request.

14.22B.3

Before making a request under sub-paragraph  (1) , the Secretary of State must
consult the TRA.

14.22B.4

The TRA must comply with a request under sub-paragraph  (1) .

16

16.1

The Treasury or the Secretary of State may by regulations made by statutory
instrument make such provision as the Treasury or the Secretary of State, as
the case may be, considers appropriate in relation to trade remedies measures
transitioned under Part 12 of the Trade Remedies (Dumping and Subsidisation)
(EU Exit) Regulations 2019 ( S.I. 2019/450 ), including provision—

16.1.a

in relation to exemptions that has effect from IP completion day (or any later
day);

16.1.b

conferring functions (including functions involving the exercise of a
discretion) on the Secretary of State or the Trade Remedies Authority.

16.2

A statutory instrument containing regulations under sub-paragraph (1) is
subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of the House of Commons.

##### Commencement

17

17.1

Any power to make regulations under or by virtue of this Schedule comes into
force on the day on which this Act is passed.

17.2

The remaining provisions of this Schedule come into force on such day as the
Secretary of State may by regulations appoint.

17.3

The Secretary of State may by regulations make transitional or saving
provision in connection with the coming into force of any provision of this
Schedule.

17.4

The power to make regulations under sub-paragraph  (3)  includes power to make
different provision for different purposes.

17.5

Regulations under this paragraph are to be made by statutory instrument.

2

After Schedule 5 of that Act insert—

Increase in imports as a result of free trade agreement causing serious injury
to UK producers

Section 13

########### Application of this Schedule

2.1

2.1.1

Schedule 5 (increase in imports causing serious injury to UK producers)
applies in relation to a relevant increase in imports subject to the following
paragraphs of this Schedule.

2.1.2

For the purposes of  sub-paragraph (1)  a “relevant increase in imports”
occurs where—

2.1.2.a

goods have been or are being, or may have been or may be being, imported into
the United Kingdom in increased quantities,

2.1.2.b

the importation of the goods in increased quantities was or is, or may have
been or may be being, caused by the reduction or elimination of import duty as
a result of a free trade agreement, and

2.1.2.c

the importation of the goods in increased quantities has caused or is causing,
or may have caused or may be causing, serious injury to UK producers of those
goods.

2.1.3

In  sub-paragraph (2) (c)  “serious injury” and “UK producers” have the
meaning that they have for the purposes of Schedule 5 (see paragraphs 2 and 3
of that Schedule).

########### TRA and Secretary of State required to have regard to relevant free trade agreement

2.2

In applying the provisions of Schedule 5 in accordance with this Schedule the
TRA and the Secretary of State must have regard to the relevant free trade
agreement.

########### Meaning of importation in “increased quantities”

2.3

Paragraph 1 of Schedule 5 (meaning of importation in “increased quantities”)
is to be read as if, in paragraph (c) of sub-paragraph (2), the words from
“including provision” to the end were omitted.

########### Bilateral safeguarding investigation

2.4

Paragraph 6 of Schedule 5 (safeguarding investigation) is to be read as if, in
sub-paragraph (1)—

2.4.a

the “and” at the end of paragraph (a) were omitted;

2.4.b

after that paragraph there were inserted—

2.4.b.aa

whether the importation of the goods in increased quantities was or is being
caused by the reduction or elimination of import duty as a result of a free
trade agreement, and

########### Initiation of a bilateral safeguarding investigation

2.5

2.5.1

Paragraph 7 of Schedule 5 (initiation of a safeguarding investigation) is to
be read subject to the following modifications.

2.5.2

Sub-paragraph (1) is to be read as if—

2.5.2.a

in the words before paragraph (a), for “The TRA may initiate” there were
substituted  “The Secretary of State may request that the TRA initiates” ;

2.5.2.b

paragraph (a) were omitted;

2.5.2.c

in paragraph (b)—

2.5.2.c.i

in the words before sub-paragraph (i), for “it is satisfied that the
application contains” there were substituted  “the Secretary of State is
satisfied that there is” ;

2.5.2.c.ii

the “and” at the end of sub-paragraph (i) were omitted;

2.5.2.c.iii

after that sub-paragraph there were inserted—

2.5.2.c.iii.ia

the importation of the goods in increased quantities was or is being caused by
the reduction or elimination of import duty as a result of the relevant free
trade agreement, and

;

2.5.2.d

in paragraph (c)—

2.5.2.d.i

for “the TRA” there were substituted  “the Secretary of State” ;

############### Registration

2.19.28A

2.19.28A.1

The Secretary of State may publish a notice of goods—

2.19.28A.1.a

which are the subject of an investigation or other proceedings under provision
made by or under this Schedule, and

2.19.28A.1.b

to which a provisional or definitive bilateral safeguarding amount or a
provisional or definitive suspension of tariff rate reduction may be applied
or the existing application of such an amount or reduction to which may be
varied.

2.19.28A.2

HMRC must register goods in respect of which such a notice is published.

2.19.28A.3

Regulations may make provision for, or in connection with, the registration by
HMRC of the goods—

2.19.28A.3.a

to which a provisional or definitive bilateral safeguarding amount or a
provisional or definitive suspension of tariff rate reduction may be applied,
or

2.19.28A.3.b

the existing application of a provisional or definitive bilateral safeguarding
amount or a provisional or definitive suspension of tariff rate reduction to

########### Reports and updates by the TRA and Secretary of State

2.20

2.20.1

This paragraph applies where, in accordance with Schedule 5 as applied by this
Schedule—

2.20.1.a

the Secretary of State accepts or rejects a recommendation made by the TRA
under any provision of that Schedule;

2.20.1.b

the TRA determines that there is no recommendation which it could make.

2.20.2

The Secretary of State may—

2.20.2.a

produce and publish a report or update in relation to the bilateral
safeguarding investigation concerned;

2.20.2.b

request that the TRA produces such a report or update.

2.20.3

Where the Secretary of State makes a request under  sub-paragraph (2) (b) —

2.20.3.a

the TRA must produce a report or update (as the case may be) in accordance
with the request, and

2.20.3.b

the Secretary of State may publish the report or update.

########### Secretary of State required to publish notice of decision about whether to apply remedy

2.21

2.21.1

Any provision of Schedule 5 requiring the Secretary of State to publish notice
of a determination of the TRA, of a recommendation under paragraph 11(3)(a),
(aa) or (b) of that Schedule and of the acceptance or rejection of it is to be
read instead as requiring the Secretary of State to publish notice of the
Secretary of State’s decision to apply, or not to apply, a provisional
bilateral safeguarding amount, a provisional suspension of tariff rate
reduction, or a provisional tariff rate quota.

2.21.2

Any provision of Schedule 5 requiring the Secretary of State to publish notice
of a determination of the TRA, of a recommendation under paragraph 16(3)(a),
(aa) or (b) of that Schedule and of the acceptance or rejection of it is to be
read instead as requiring the Secretary of State to publish notice of the
Secretary of State’s decision to apply, or not to apply, a definitive
bilateral safeguarding amount, a definitive suspension of tariff rate
reduction, or a tariff rate quota.

########### Secretary of State not required to lay statements before the House of Commons

2.22

The provisions of Schedule 5 imposing a requirement on the Secretary of State
to lay a statement before the House of Commons do not apply in relation to any
matter concerning a bilateral safeguarding investigation (and accordingly the
Secretary of State is not required to lay such a statement).

########### Interpretation

2.23

2.23.1

Paragraph 31 of Schedule 5 (interpretation) applies subject to  sub-paragraph
(2) .

2.23.2

In Schedule 5 as applied by this Schedule—

2.23.2.a

references to a definitive safeguarding amount are to be read as references to
a definitive bilateral safeguarding amount or a definitive suspension of
tariff rate reduction (as the case may be);

2.23.2.b

references to a provisional safeguarding amount are to be read as references
to a provisional bilateral safeguarding amount or a provisional suspension of
tariff rate reduction (as the case may be);

2.23.2.c

references to a safeguarding investigation are to be read as references to a
bilateral safeguarding investigation;

2.23.2.d

references to a safeguarding remedy are to be read as references to a
bilateral safeguarding remedy.

2.24

For the purposes of this Schedule and of Schedule 5 as applied by this
Schedule—

“ bilateral safeguarding investigation ” means an investigation under
paragraph 6 of Schedule 5 as that provision applies by virtue of this
Schedule; “ bilateral safeguarding remedy ” has the meaning given in paragraph
23(4)(a) of Schedule 5 as that provision applies by virtue of this Schedule; “
definitive bilateral safeguarding amount ” means the additional amount of
import duty mentioned in paragraph 16(3)(a) of Schedule 5 as that provision
applies by virtue of this Schedule. “ definitive suspension of tariff rate
reduction ” has the meaning given in paragraph (aa) of paragraph 16(3) of
Schedule 5 (see  paragraph 11 (1) (a) ); “ free trade agreement ” has the
meaning given in section 5(1) of the Trade Act 2021; “ provisional bilateral
safeguarding amount ” means the additional amount of import duty mentioned in
paragraph (11)(3)(a) of Schedule 5 as that provision applies by virtue of this
Schedule; “ provisional suspension of tariff rate reduction ” has the meaning
given in paragraph (aa) of paragraph 11(3) of Schedule 5 (see  paragraph 8 (1)
(a) ); “ relevant free trade agreement ”, in relation to a bilateral
safeguarding investigation, means the free trade agreement mentioned in
paragraph 6(aa) of Schedule 5 (see  paragraph 4 (b) ).

##### Commencement

3

3.1

Any power to make regulations under or by virtue of this Schedule comes into
force on the day on which this Act is passed.

3.2

The remaining provisions of this Schedule come into force on such day as the
Secretary of State may by regulations appoint.

3.3

The Secretary of State may by regulations make transitional or saving
provision in connection with the coming into force of any provision of this
Schedule.

3.4

The power to make regulations under sub-paragraph (3) includes power to make
different provision for different purposes.

3.5

Regulations under this paragraph are to be made by statutory instrument.

                 Soft drinks industry levy: flavour concentrates

Section 321

##### Introduction

1

Part 2 of FA 2017 (soft drinks industry levy) is amended as follows.

##### Meaning of “soft drink” and “package”

2

2.1

Section 26 (“ soft drink ” and “ package ”) is amended as follows.

2.2

At the end of subsection (1) insert  “;

2.2.c

a liquid flavouring (a “flavour concentrate”) which, when processed in a
specified manner in a dispensing machine, constitutes a beverage within that
paragraph.

2.3

After subsection (2) insert—

2.3.2A

A flavour concentrate is processed in a specified manner if—

2.3.2A.a

it is combined with added sugar ingredients, with or without—

2.3.2A.a.i

artificial sweeteners, or

2.3.2A.a.ii

one or more other flavour concentrates; and

2.3.2A.b

the flavour concentrate (or combination) is prepared in a specified manner.

2.3.2B

A “dispensing machine” is a machine designed to—

2.3.2B.a

combine, process or prepare ingredients so as to produce a beverage, and

2.3.2B.b

supply the beverage directly to a consumer.

2.3.2C

In subsection (2A)(a), “ added sugar ingredients ” means anything within
paragraph (a) or (b) of section 29(2).

2.4

In subsection (3)—

2.4.a

omit the “and” at the end of paragraph (a);

2.4.b

after paragraph (b) insert

and

2.4.b.c

in the case of a soft drink within subsection (1)(c)—

2.4.b.c.i

it is suitable to be consumed when processed in a specified manner in a
dispensing machine (and without any other processing or preparation), and

2.4.b.c.ii

it is ready for use in a dispensing machine;

.

##### Meaning of “prepared drinks”

3

3.1

Section 27 (meaning of “ prepared drink ”) is amended as follows.

3.2

At the end of subsection (1) insert  “;

3.2.c

a beverage that would result from—

3.2.c.i

processing a flavour concentrate within subsection (1)(c) of that section in a
specified manner in a dispensing machine, and

3.2.c.ii

in accordance with the relevant dispensing instructions.

3.3

In subsection (2)(b), for “subsection (3)” substitute  “subsection (3)(a)” .

3.4

After subsection (2) insert—

3.4.2A

The “ relevant dispensing instructions ” means—

3.4.2A.a

the instructions for use of the flavour concentrate provided with, or for the
purposes of use with, the concentrate or a dispensing machine with which it is
designed to be used;

3.4.2A.b

where subsection (3)(b) or (4A) applies, the dispensing instructions
determined by the Commissioners.

3.5

For subsection (3) substitute—

3.5.3

This subsection applies where—

3.5.3.a

in a case within subsection (1)(b), the packaging of the soft drink states
neither the dilution ratio nor information by reference to which the dilution
ratio can be calculated;

3.5.3.b

in a case within subsection (1)(c), no dispensing instructions are provided
with, or for the purposes of use with, the flavour concentrate or with any
dispensing machine with which it is designed to be used.

3.6

After subsection (4) insert—

3.6.4A

This subsection applies where—

3.6.4A.a

dispensing instructions are provided, and

3.6.4A.b

it is reasonable to assume that the main purpose, or one of the main purposes,
of providing those particular dispensing instructions is avoiding or reducing
liability for soft drinks industry levy.

3.7

In subsection (5)—

3.7.a

after paragraph (a) insert—

3.7.a.aa

determining dispensing instructions for the purposes of subsection (2A)(b);

;

3.7.b

for paragraph (b) substitute—

3.7.b.b

determining whether the main purpose, or one of the main purposes, of—

3.7.b.b.i

stating a particular dilution ratio or information, or

3.7.b.b.ii

providing particular dispensing instructions;

is avoiding or reducing liability for soft drinks industry levy.

##### Sugar content condition

4

In section 29 (sugar content condition), in subsection (1)—

4.a

in the words before paragraph (a), omit “it contains”;

4.b

for paragraph (a) (but not the “and” at the end) substitute—

4.b.a

either—

4.b.a.i

it is a soft drink within section 26(1)(c), or

4.b.a.ii

it contains added sugar ingredients;

;

4.c

at the beginning of paragraph (b) insert  “it contains” .

##### Exempt soft drinks

5

In section 30 (exempt soft drinks), in subsection (1)—

5.a

omit the “and” at the end of paragraph (c);

5.b

after paragraph (d) insert  “, and

5.b.e

soft drinks within section 26(1)(c) (flavour concentrates) that meet such
conditions as may be specified.

##### Levy rates

6

After section 36 (levy rates) insert—

######### Determining levy rate for flavour concentrates

6.36A

6.36A.1

This section applies where—

6.36A.1.a

two or more flavour concentrates are formulated so as to be combined with one
another in a dispensing machine (see section 26(2A)(a)(ii)), and

6.36A.1.b

each of those flavour concentrates is a chargeable soft drink.

6.36A.2

The references in section 36(1) to a litre of prepared drink are treated, in
relation to each of the flavour concentrates, as references to the relevant
proportion of a litre of prepared drink.

6.36A.3

Subject to subsection (4), the “relevant proportion” is—

    1 N       where N is the number of flavour concentrates that are designed
to be combined.

6.36A.4

The Commissioners may by regulations make provision for determining the
relevant proportion (otherwise than in accordance with subsection (3)) in
cases where the flavour concentrates mentioned in subsection (1)(a) are
formulated so as to be combined in a dispensing machine—

6.36A.4.a

in unequal proportions, or

6.36A.4.b

in different combinations for different beverages.

##### Tax credits

7

7.1

Section 39 (tax credits) is amended as follows.

7.2

In subsection (1), after paragraph (b) insert

;

7.2.c

in the case of soft drinks within section 26(1)(c), the flavour concentrate—

7.2.c.i

has not been combined with added sugar ingredients (but has been prepared in a
specified manner), or

7.2.c.ii

has been processed in a specified manner so as to result in a beverage that
contains less than 5 grams of sugars per 100 millilitres of prepared drink.

7.3

In subsection (2)(a) for “exported or (as the case may be) lost or destroyed”
substitute  “that fall within subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c) (as the case may
be)” .

##### Commencement

8

The amendments made by this Schedule come into force on 1 April 2023 in
relation to soft drinks that are packaged in, or imported into, the United
Kingdom on or after that date.

6.c

6.c.i

7

paid), in subsection (1), for the words before paragraph (a) substitute—

If a person uses or keeps a UK heavy goods vehicle on a road to which this Act
applies by virtue of section 3(1A)(a), or uses a non-UK heavy goods vehicle on
a road to which this Act applies by virtue of section 3(1A)(b), on a day in
respect of which the HGV road user levy charged in respect of the vehicle has
not been paid—

.

                 Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme: exemptions from tax

Section 346

##### Income tax and corporation tax

1

1.1

No liability to income tax or corporation tax arises in respect of a payment
which is made by a local authority to a person (“ S ”) by reason of S—

1.1.a

being an approved sponsor under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme, and

1.1.b

providing accommodation to a person granted entry clearance or permission to
stay under that scheme.

1.2

This paragraph  has effect in relation to payments made on or after 14 March
2022.

##### Annual tax on enveloped dwellings

2

2.1

Part 3 of FA 2013 (annual tax on enveloped dwellings) is modified as follows.

2.2

That Part has effect as if after section 133 there were inserted—

########### Deemed property rental business: Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

2.2.133A

2.2.133A.1

A day in a chargeable period (“day X”) is to be treated as relievable in
relation to a single-dwelling interest by virtue of section 133(1) (property
rental business) if (ignoring this section) day X is not relievable by virtue
of any of the provisions listed in section 132(3) and—

2.2.133A.1.a

in a case where the day immediately before day X was relievable in relation to
a single-dwelling interest by virtue of section 133(1) (including by virtue of
this section), Condition A or B is met in relation the dwelling on day X, or

2.2.133A.1.b

in a case where the day immediately before day X was not relievable in
relation to a single-dwelling interest by virtue of section 133(1), Condition
A is met in relation to the dwelling on day X.

2.2.133A.2

For the purposes of subsection (1)—

2.2.133A.2.a

Condition A is that the dwelling is exclusively occupied by an individual (or
individuals) granted entry clearance, or permission to stay, under the Homes
for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme;

2.2.133A.2.b

Condition B is that reasonable steps are being taken to secure that the
dwelling will, without undue delay, be so occupied.

2.2.133A.3

A day is not relievable by virtue of this section in the case of a single-
dwelling interest if on that day a non-qualifying individual is permitted to
occupy the dwelling.

2.2.133A.4

In subsection (2)(b), “ without undue delay ” means without delay except so
far as delay is justified by commercial considerations or cannot be avoided.

2.3

Section 138 (property developers) has effect as if for subsection (2) there
were substituted—

2.3.2

If the property developer holds an interest for the purpose mentioned in
subsection (1)(b), any additional purpose the property developer may have of—

2.3.2.a

exploiting the interest as a source of rents or other receipts in the course
of a qualifying property rental business (after developing the land and before
reselling it), or

2.3.2.b

permitting an individual granted entry clearance, or permission to stay, under
the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme to occupy the dwelling,

is treated as not being a separate purpose in applying the test in subsection
(1)(b).

2.4

Section 141 (property traders) has effect as if, after subsection (2), there
were inserted—

2.4.2A

If the person holds an interest for the purpose mentioned in subsection
(1)(b), any additional purpose the person may have of permitting an
individual, other than a non-qualifying individual, who is granted entry
clearance, or permission to stay, under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship
Scheme to occupy the dwelling is treated as not being a separate purpose in
applying the test in subsection (1)(b).

2.5

Section 174 (general interpretation) has effect as if, in subsection (1), at
the appropriate place, there were inserted—

                                             “ the Homes for Ukraine
Sponsorship Scheme ” means the scheme contained in paragraphs UKR 11.1 to UKR
20.2 of Appendix Ukraine Scheme to the immigration rules (within the meaning
of the Immigration Act 1971);

.

2.6

The modifications made by  this paragraph  have effect in relation to days
falling in the period—

2.6.a

beginning with 1 April 2022, and

2.6.b

ending with such date as may be specified in regulations made by the Treasury
by statutory instrument.

##### Stamp duty land tax

3

3.1

Schedule 4A to FA 2003 (stamp duty land tax: higher rate for certain
transactions) is modified as follows.

3.2

Paragraph 5 (businesses of letting, trading in or redeveloping properties) has
effect as if after sub-paragraph (2) there were inserted—

3.2.2A

In determining whether a chargeable interest has been acquired exclusively for
one or more of those purposes, any intention to permit an individual, other
than a non-qualifying individual, who is granted entry clearance, or
permission to stay, under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme to occupy
any dwelling on the land is to be ignored.

3.3

In paragraph 5G (withdrawal of relief allowed under paragraph 5), sub-
paragraph (4) has effect as if—

3.3.a

the words from “because of a change of circumstances” to the end become
paragraph (a);

3.3.b

after that paragraph there were inserted—

3.3.b.b

any dwelling on the land is occupied by an individual granted entry clearance,
or permission to stay, under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme, or

3.3.b.c

the purchaser is taking reasonable steps to ensure that any dwelling on the
land will be so occupied without delay (except so far as delay may be
justified by commercial considerations or cannot be avoided)

;

3.4

Paragraph 9 (interpretation) has effect as if, at the appropriate place, there
were inserted—

                                             “ the Homes for Ukraine
Sponsorship Scheme ” means the scheme contained in paragraphs UKR 11.1 to UKR
20.2 of Appendix Ukraine Scheme to the immigration rules (within the meaning
of the Immigration Act 1971);

.

3.5

The modification made by  sub-paragraph (2)  has effect in relation to any
land transaction the effective date of which is in the period—

3.5.a

beginning with 31 March 2022, and

3.5.b

ending with such date as may be specified in regulations made by the Treasury
by statutory instrument.

3.6

The modifications made by  sub-paragraph (3)  and  (4)  have effect in
relation to any time in the period mentioned in  sub-paragraph (5) .
